story:
Hi, my name is Martin Psota. I am an adventurer from the Czech Republic. I lost my home, friends, family, work. I became a homeless man. I decided to build transatlantic raft and sail around the world, there where me wind and currents lead. Sorry for my English mistakes. Help me find a new path of life. Thank you very much. God let him accompany you peacefully. Thank you!

Your donations are for the payment material, sails, ropes, equipment, rescue system, gps phone, hall rental, travel visas, transportation the raft trucks, food and more ...



Many photos can be found here: http://expedice-yuchin-ho.webnode.cz/vor-pro-bohace/

Children in Taiwan, wanted to support the expedition Yuchin Ho


Since the Czech Republic is the center of Europe, we are deprived of the sea. Whoever of you have visited on holiday sea, it immediately fell in love. After what goes into the voyage by sea, the experience is unforgettable. And so I tasted the smell and taste of the waves and the desire to go back there is very strong when I built a small raft in Taiwan and tried to sail to Japan. Therefore, I decided to go back to the sea and motivated by a true story from April 28, 1947 data, which embarked on a cruise 6 men on a self-built raft. The leader of the expedition was Thor Heyerdahl, Herman Watzinger, who was responsible for meteorological and technical research Kunt Haugland and Torstein Raabe, two radio operators, who maintained contact from amateurs, Erik Hesselberg as a navigator and controlled throughout the construction of the raft and the Swedish sociologist Bengt Danielson, who was administrator of the raft.


Later repeated the voyage grandson of Thor Heyerdahl

story:
FRSH (For Sharing Hope) is a “socialprise” (for-profit/social-enterprise) that creates the highest-quality handcrafted organic soap products. Our social mission is to reduce the number of families around the world without access to basic sanitation. For every organic bar of soap you buy, FRSH will give a standard bar of soap to a child or family in need. FRSH partners with the Hope Sharing Foundation, a 501 (c) non-profit organization, to fulfill its soap giving and sustainability projects.




The Internet has put us in a unique and equal position to make a lasting difference on this planet and in people's lives. Together, we can succeed in bringing basic sanitation to many underserved communities. Every time you use one of our soaps, you are instilling hope to those in need.



Some of us take cleanliness for granted, but imagine living without soap. This sobering reality affects 2.6 billion people across the globe. For children, hygiene and sanitation-related illnesses, such as diarrhea, cholera, and pneumonia, are the #1 killer. Each year, two million children will not live to celebrate their 5th birthday. Overall, these types of illnesses are the #4 killer among all age groups.


Providing soap is among the most effective ways to combat against preventable illnesses. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), "hand washing could save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention."




At FRSH we believe access to soap is a human right. As stated in the the U.N. Universal Declaration of Human Rights (Article 25): "Everyone has the right to a standard of living adequate for the health and well-being of himself and his family."



With the FRSH pledge, we match every bar of organic soap purchased with a standard bar of soap given to a child in need. To make the greatest impact, we partner with suppliers in Africa to afford large quantities of standard bars of soap to local villages and towns.






We believe that feeling good on the outside is as important as feeling good on the inside when using FRSH. We provide our supporters with premium handcrafted organic bar soaps using only the freshest certified-natural ingredients.

Experience the FRSH difference. Our organic soap bars are perfect for your body, face, and hair. FRSH soaps are a safe and hygienic choice for babies and children. 






Say goodbye to sloppy, mushy soap! Have your soap dry perfectly every time and ready to use on your next wash. Our magnetic holder will reduce waste left in soap dishes by up to 30%. The holder is attachable to any sink or shower wall.  





Our soaps are made with ONLY the highest-quality ingredients and include:


We do NOT use any of the following materials in our soaps:





We strive to have the most positive impact on the environment. Our plantable eco-friendly soap box is handcrafted from double-recycled paper, printed with soy ink, and embedded with wildflower seeds. Plant our box, add water, and watch beautiful flowers bloom!




Due to the urgency of the Ebola crisis, FRSH is focusing its giving mission to aid children and families in high-risk West African countries. With your support, FRSH will be able to significantly expand its mission to more locations around the world.



FRSH is seeking $50,000 to continue providing the highest-quality handcrafted organic soap products and to increase the number of underserved families with access to basic sanitation. Everyone deserves an opportunity for a healthy life. Take action today and make a lasting impact in people's lives. Give soap, share hope.


What are the dimensions and weight of a FRSH bar of soap?

1 FRSH bar of soap is 3.5 Oz. 3.25”x 2.25”x1”. (See pictures in gallery)

When I buy an organic bar of FRSH soap, does FRSH donate the same product?

All of our FRSH organic soaps and their ingredients are handpicked and hand-cut in the U.S.A. However, to have the greatest impact in the local communities we serve, and to maximize our giving projects, the standard soaps we donate are produced in our partner countries. 

Are we a non-profit organization? Can I write-off my contribution on my taxes?

We are for-profit company and contributions are not tax deductible.

For more information please contact us.

How will the funds be used?

  • Research and development of new soap formulas and ingredients
  • Production cycle tooling and refinement
  • Machinery & supplementary tools for production
  • Quality test and inspection
  • Hiring more staff
  • Soap donations in Africa and South East Asia
  • Sustainability projects (water wells, soap factories)

Do you ship internationally?

Yes, we ship everywhere in the world except:

Central African Republic - CF
Comoros
Cuba
Equatorial Guinea - GQ
Falklands
Guinea Bissau - GW
Iran - IR
Johnston Island
Kiribati
Korea, North (North Korea)
Mayotte Island
Myanmar - MM
Nauru
Niue
Saint Pierre Et Miquelon
Sao Tome & Principe
Sierra Leone - SL
Solomon Islands
Somalia - SO
St. Helena (S. Atlantic)
Sudan - SD
Syria - SY
Tajikistan
Tokelau Islands
Turkmenistan, Republic Of - TM
Tuvalu
Wake Islands

Does shipping cost extra?

We provide free shipping on U.S. orders. 

For international orders: Please add $25 for all orders up to $25. And add $50 for The Full Shebang perk only.

Am I supposed to manually add shipping?

Yes,  please add the indicated shipping rate (US or international) to the selected perk price.

What if I already contributed and forgot to add shipping?

Here’s what you need to do:

1. Click "Contribute Now".

2. After the question, "Which perk would you like?,” click on the first option: "No perk, I just want to contribute." 

3. Enter the correct shipping amount.

4. Follow the instructions for payment.

Can I get a refund?

Sorry, unfortunately Indiegogo’s policy is no refunds.  Please see more on Indiegogo’s rules.

Still curious?

Please visit www.gofrsh.com or email us at hello@gofrsh.com. We will get back to you as soon as we can!

How else can I get involved?

The best way for you to get involved is by sharing our video and our campaign with your friends and family. Also, please make sure to keep yourself updated and follow us on Facebook, Instagram, or Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

Containing this recent Ebola Outbreak in Africa Prompted this project. Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) is a deadly contagious Disease with very high fatality rate, and no licensed cure (as at time of posting this), in Africa the disease has killed over 1841 people out of the over 3685 "reported" cases. This Disease has affected Americans, British, Spaniards, Liberians, Guineans, Sierra –Leonean, Congolese, Sudanese, Senegalese, Nigerians e.t.c . 

The Aim of the Project is to Create Mobile Applications that can Detect if a particular location is affected by Ebola Virus disease and Help users of the Mobile Application to prevent contracting the deadly disease even if they stay in the affected areas. We have the FREE Ebola Detection and Prevention App on Android PlayStore already, we need to ensure that this powerful technology App is available FREE and accessible all regardless of your language, Phone OS, and other limiting factors, hence the reason for this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

Funds sourced will be used for the below

  1. Keeping in touch regularly with All Local ,State and National Epidemiology Departments of Ministry of Health of affected Countries to ensure that users of the Applications are updated regularly
  2. Publicizing the availability of the Application so that everyone in Affected area and beyond can know about it and make use of the technology/App
  3. Maintenance of the server hosting the applications
  4. Implementing the Application for IOS, Blackberry OS, WebOS, J2ME, SYMBIAN, SMS so that everyone can have access to the technology regardless of the mobile phone type you use.At the moment we have only implemented for Android Phones 


    The Impact

    • This Project will enable Affected Countries contain the current outbreak faster, and also prevent unaffected people from contacting the deadly disease.
    • The Aim of this project is to use Technology to assist towards the containment of this outbreak and altogether help make this outbreak a history.
    • It will increase your awareness to your risk of exposure if you are in affected areas so as to take preventive steps to avoid contacting the disease.

      Risks & Challenges

      • Getting Accurate Data from Local, State, and National Ministry of health's of affected countries, will be a challenge, however we are following WHO regularly to ensure that 
      • Implementing in a cost effective way for Feature phones that do not have Location devices, 
      • Localization of the Applications to ensure everyone has the application in a language he/she readily understands.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        1. You can Share this Project on your Social Media Pages (Facebook, Twitter, Google+ Linkedin etc)
        2. If you can help us solve the challenges we identified above 
        3. Translating App information to your local language.

story:
Allan Herdecker - A Member of the Eagleswood Volunteer Fire Company and the New Jersey State Forest Fire Service is in need of a kidney transplant. Diagnosed with Polycystic Kidney Disease his kidneys have started to fail. He currently is on dialysis 3x a week and has now been placed on a kidney donor list. 

Kidney transplantation is an option available to patients with (CKD). Either on or approaching dialysis. Kidneys for transplantation come from two sources - living and deceased donors. A living donor is usually a family member, spouse or friend. A deceased donor was an individual who donated their organs. Although living donor transplantation is the best option for those patients who have a willing donor, many patients will have to go on a waiting list and receive there kidney from a deceased donor. To be placed on the waiting list and explore your potential transplant options such as living donation, the first step is to attend a Pre-Transplant Education Program and Evaluation (which Allan has attended). 

His medical bills are pilling up and we are looking to help relieve some of the stress he is enduring every day. please donate anything you can if you live in the area and want to see if there is anything you can do too help please get in contact with us threw here or facebook

story:
"The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is the be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well."                                                                                                                                                                 -  Ralph Waldo Emerson 

Social Enterprise

Who we are: We are a group of passionate students in the Social Enterprise in Nicaragua course at Emory University (and part of Social Enterprise @ Goizueta). We are partnering with the Nicaragua Community Health Connection and the people of Los Robles, a coffee community in northern Nicaragua, to support the community's first and only health clinic. We would love to have you join us in our effort to provide much needed medical care for this beautiful community.

The NCHC: The Nicaragua Community Health Connection (NCHC) is an organization devoted to bettering communities all over Nicaragua. By countering poverty and isolation, investing in social capital, and stimulating local leadership, the NCHC is improving the lives of thousands of people. NCHC serves to connect the people of Los Robles with the valuable resources and networks that NCHC Advocates and other supporters can provide (like yourself!). We are proud to call them a partner in our mission. 

For more information about the NCHC: http://www.nicachc.org/

Why?: We should all do what we can to help those in need. Nicaragua is the second poorest country in the Western Hemisphere, with 42% of the population living in extreme poverty. Unable to afford the proper healthcare, many Nicaraguan people are suffering from very preventable and treatable diseases and injuries. We are going to change that. Through the power of networks and community, we plan to connect the Los Robles clinic with you in order to significantly improve the lives of this community.

The Campaign

The Team: We are a group of 6 students studying Social Enterprise at Emory University's Goizueta Business School. Throughout the course, we study the hardships a small community like Los Robles endures. When we learned about the immediate need for proper medical care, we knew we had to help. With your generous donations, we will become successful in our current mission. Ultimately, we hope our success will inspire other students at Emory University to participate and support the Social Enterprise @ Goizueta movement. Together, we can make a difference. 
The Mission: We are raising money to purchase medical supplies as well as provide a salary for a full-time medical staff to run the Los Robles Clinic. All of your donations will go directly to helping the clinic provide much needed healthcare to the members of the community. This is our time to step up and help those in need, but we need your help. 
The Trip: On May 8th until the 17th, the Social Enterprise class will be traveling down to Nicaragua to visit the clinic firsthand as well as experience the country's vibrant culture. Because of your generous donations, we will be arriving to a fully stocked and staffed clinic. 

The Incentives

If you donate one of the following amounts, you will receive: 
Ten Dollars: We will email you an album of pictures of the clinic from our trip. You'll be able to see all the good from your generous donations!
Fifty Dollars: A bag of Farmers to 40 coffee, a high quality coffee that promises to pay the coffee farmers who grew the beans 40% of the purchase price. 
       
       

Two-Hundred & Fifty Dollars: An authentic high-quality Nicaraguan hammock hand woven by Centro Social Tio Antonio, an organization in Granada, Nicargua, working to provide education, health, and economic opportunities to people in need.                           

       

For further info on Centro Social Tio Antonio: Centro Social Tio Antonio Website

Other Ways You Can Help!

Can't donate? Help out anyway! By sharing this campaign with your friends and family, you can do your part in helping the Los Robles community!

story:
Due to recent investor activity, we've suspended this campaign.

If you'd like to learn more about skyTran, including investment and partnering opportunities, please visit our website at: http://www.skytran.us


Connect, Follow, and Like Us on:

Twitter:  https://twitter.com/skytran

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Sky.Tran

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/skytran


High-Speed, Low-Cost, Green, Elevated, Personal Rapid Transit

skyTran—a NASA Space Act Company—is developing a network of computer-controlled, 2-person, “jet-like” vehicles that use state-of-the-art, skyTran MagLev technology. skyTran will revolutionize public transportation and, with it, urban and suburban commuting.

After years of ground-breaking R&D and perfecting its proprietary technology at NASA Research Park, skyTran is in the process of constructing a Technology Demonstration System (TDS). The TDS will demonstrate skyTran’s innovative engineering in a controlled environment.

10 things you should know:

1. skyTran is fast.
The vehicles take you directly to your destination at speeds up to 150mph with no stops and no delays in between. Traffic jams do not exist with skyTran. Sit back and enjoy an uninterrupted ride from your rural community directly to downtown as you fly above the congestion below. 


2. skyTran is available 24/7.
Use your smartphone or tablet to call up a personal vehicle "just for you" as you walk over to to your neighborhood station. There are no schedules to follow. There is no waiting in line. We call it "on-demand" for a reason. When you want it, it is there.

3. skyTran doesn't pollute.
We are as green as a transportation system can get. The patented skyTran MagLev technology allows the vehicles to ride almost-silently on a magnetic wave with zero emissions. A big, fat, clean ZERO.

4. skyTran needs very little energy.
A skyTran vehicle only uses as much energy as two household hair dryers. And because the tracks and poles are ideal platforms for solar and wind power, skyTran comes as close to being energy-free as is possible for mass transit or any other type of mass transportation.

5. skyTran is inexpensive to build.
The modular aluminum poles and rails, and the lightweight vehicles are manufactured in a plant and assembled on site. This type of Installation is quick and easy with very little right-of-way needed. Install it right over sidewalks. Run the tracks over a city plaza or across an open field. 'Kind of like assembling a kid's building blocks. But, this is for grown-ups, too.

6. skyTran is inexpensive to run.
The low energy needed, elimination of ticket takers, operators, conductors, and the like, make skyTran a cost-effective system for communities, universities,  businesses, and more. The amazing skyTran computer network does it all. You just get to enjoy it in privacy, comfort and your pocketbook will thank you.

7. skyTran is inexpensive to maintain.
There is no "wear and tear" and virtually no moving parts with skyTran. The skyTran MagLev system is incredibly simple and almost indestructible. If a natural disaster or other event damaged a track, the skyTran computers automatically and safely reroute the vehicles, while new track and poles can be bolted in place.

8. skyTran is safe.
The computer knows who is riding and how to get them to their destination securely. The MagLev technology is very safe and able to react quickly. If you want to change destinations, or get off early, just punch it into the big touch screen in front of you and... done! 

9. skyTran looks great.
The small, sleek skytran vehicles and low profile rails and tracks don't create an eyesore. Because skyTran can go above ground, underground, or on the ground, the system can be made to blend into the environment. The lightweight skyTran vehicles can even go inside buildings. Would you like to go from your own neighborhood to directly inside a shopping mall? Hop on board.

10. skyTran is a whole lot more.
There is much more to tell you, but we are running out of space and you need to check out our perks on the right side of this page. The skyTran team has been able to successfully answer every objection and every question posed to it from hundreds of transportation planners, companies, agencies, governments, and the public from around the world. If you have any doubts, questions, or concerns, please feel free to reach us at: info@skytran.us

skyTran will make a difference in how people commute. Dirty, expensive, crowded, and slow transportation is not the future we wish for ourselves or our children. skyTran is less expensive to build, operate, and maintain than any other transportation system. 

Tell you friends, family, and colleagues about skyTran so that we can make the world a safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable place to live, work, and play.

Let us make your commute a joy. You can thank us later.

story:
Story

Baby E, came as a blessing after 4 miscarriages. After a complicated pregnancy, she was induced at 34 weeks for intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR). E spent her first 3 weeks in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU). She had 2 small ventricular septal defects (VSD) and a patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) significant in size. The PDA, which is an open fetal blood vessel that should’ve closed after birth, affects the ability to feed and breathe resulting in poor growth. 

When 5 weeks later, it still had not closed, E, only a mere 4 lbs was re-hospitalized in the NICU for intravenous Indocin, a medication that can close the ductus. The treatment was unsuccessful despite everyone's high hopes. Two weeks later, her parents knew something was wrong when she stopped feeding and experienced greater difficulty breathing. They took her to the Emergency Room. She was again admitted, this time for acute congestive heart failure (CHF) and failure to thrive (FTT), and subsequently required nasal gastric (NG) tube feeding for nearly 2 weeks.

On January 11, 2013, at 3 and half months old, a team of UCSF cardiologists attempted to close E’s PDA via cardiac catherization. This procedure was unsuccessful, and her doctors intended to attempt another catherization when she reached a hearty 11 pounds. During her stay at UCSF, E caught a virus from her little roommate. After being home for 1 week, she was taken to the ER, where she tested positive for pneumonia and respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) resulting in hospitalization.

Unfortunately, E fell off the chart as her growth significantly slowed down. Now at 5 months, she weighs 8.5 lbs and due to her failure to thrive she needed urgent heart surgery to close the PDA. E is currently recovering in ICU at UCSF from her March 2, 2013 operation.

In addition to her cardiac condition E has proctocollitis, a formula allergy that causes lower intestinal bleeding. Her mom was able to provide breast milk for 4 months but has since stopped producing. Frustratingly, E's insurance denied coverage for the cost of her prescription to the milk bank, which is nearly $2000 each month. Fortunately, E is receiving breast milk from caring moms through casual milk sharing, and the Mother's Milk Bank is generously donating screened and pastuerized milk through March. However future donations are indeterminate at this time. 

In all, E has spent 9-plus weeks in the hospital and has had to face many obstacles and hurdles. Despite what she has been through at such a tender age, she is a miraculous fighter. And her parents, family, and friends hope her days of being in and out of the hospital are over. 

 

What We Need  

E's  mom and dad never in a million years imagined that they would become parents of a premature baby, who would consequently need a lot of medical care. Her parents are eternally grateful for your generosity and kindness.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, here are some other ways in which you can help:

  • Share this story with your friends, family, or just about anyone
  • Post a link on your Facebook, Twitter, blog or any other account that might help
  • Send positive energy and thoughts their way
  • Make every day a day for acts of kindness

Thank you so much for all your love and support, as well as caring and sharing her story. Not only are you helping baby E and her family, but you are helping in raising the awareness of premature births and congenital heart defects.

story:
Short Summary

Quinns mother, Rosemary, and I have known each other ALL of our lives. Her mother and mine were expecting at the same time. Although we are not "sisters" by blood, we are sisters by love. There is nothing that we wouldn't do for one another. I can't physically be with Rosemary right now, but I know there are other needs that I can help with. That is why I am setting up this fundraiser. 

Help.quinnnow is a fundraiser for my dearest friend, Rosemary's 21 year old son that was in a terrible explosion/accident on October 18, 2012 that required him to be transported by Medevac to a city 3 hours away. He was helping a friend on the side of a road that had run out of gas; the gas can ignited and he tried to kick it away from the vehicle and away from a main and busy road to keep others from being hurt. In doing this, his body became engulfed in flames. He received 2nd and 3rd degree burns over 50% of his body and will require many surgeries, an extensive hospital stay, rehabilitation and physical therapy. His family is at his side but both parents work full time and must travel 3 hours each way to be with their son. There will be additional medical expenses that insurance will not cover as well as traveling to/from the hospital and lost wages by both parents.

Quinn is an exceptional young man, and has made great strides in working and taking care of his young children. One of his thoughts was "my wallet burned... I had my child support money in there"... He put his children first, even in the condition that he is in! His road to recovery will be a very long, painful and tiresome one. His hands, arms, back and legs/ankles have been burned badly. He underwent the first of many surgeries this morning and it was determined that he has some nerve damage and they will have to go back to that area and perform more surgery.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We are setting a goal of $50,000.00 to cover upcoming medical bills as well as any lost wages for both Danny and Rosemary (Quinn's parents). They are on a very fixed income and will not allow them to have enough money for their monthly living expenses or to cover traveling expenses to be with their son.
  • The goal of $50,000.00  may seem out of reach, but we are hopeful that your kindness and generosity will cause you to help Quinn on his road to recovery.

The Impact

As a parent myself, I cannot imagine the pain and turmoil they are faced with each day, knowing that there is little they can do for Quinn. They have to let go and trust that he will be cared for by medical staff, extended family and friends. I can't imagine having to leave my son in a hospital to drive 3 hours away to work. I would wnat to be with my son, to help him through each day, to hold him when the pain is unbearable, to love him on the days that he needs it most, to let him feel the touch of my hand caressing his cheek, or wiping a tear.

Danny and Rosemary are incredible people, that have always worked hard to provide a good home for their family. They are two people that will do anything to help someone out. I hope that we can come together and give them some help that they desperately need through this situation.

We are praying, hoping and believing that Quinn will make an incredible recovery and will be able to share his story of a incredible family, friends and concerned people coming together to help him when he needed it most.

Thank you for taking time to visit our campaign for Quinn.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • If you cannot contribute financially, we ask that you please pray for Quinn and his family anytime you think of them.
  • Pass this link on to friends, family, local businesses that may be willing to help.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
THE DELPHIN (Patents Pending)

Just as the Delphin served as the greatest wingman of all time for the god of the sea, today's Delphin serves as the greatest workout companion of all time for runners tired of carrying around their phone and every swimmer tired of the lap swimming grind. With the Delphin, you can finally use your favorite apps in the pool. As a wearable touch-screen device with Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capabilities, the Delphin operates underwater and on land without a phone. It features access to apps, external buttons for navigating playlists and volume, and a unique design tailored for maximum portability. This wearable makes your swimming workout a joy.

Uses the same apps:

  • Spotify (Spotify Premium required for offline listening)
  • Pandora (Pandora Plus required for offline listening)
  • Audible
  • SoundCloud
  • Netflix
  • Podcast and Radio Addict

Download your content wirelessly:

Wirelessly download content by simply connecting to the WiFi hotspot at home, work, or your pool. Use the same playlists you already created on Spotify or the stations you created on Pandora. Download and sync your Audible audiobooks to the same spot you left off reading or listening to on your phone (No more attempts to fast forward through audiobooks).

Compatible with wired or Bluetooth headphones:

With each pre-order of the Delphin, we’ll send you your choice of waterproof headphones to go with it.  

  • Swimbuds Sport Waterproof Headphones have an advanced design for the best possible sound underwater. Multiple sizes and styles of earbud tips are guaranteed to help you find a good seal for any ear.
  • Swimbuds Bluetooth Waterproof Headphones are the first waterproof bluetooth headphones designed for use when actually submerged. Water distorts bluetooth signals too much for headphones to work when separated from the source of the signal. The Delphin solves that by being 100% waterproof and small enough to clip on your goggle strap. Both headphones work great above water as well!

Record your laps and times

Receive audible reminders of your lap count and split times at a frequency you decide. Made for swimmers, the Delphin will help improve your performance by enabling you to document and automatically track your laps and times so that you can keep pushing your limits. Sync your workouts with swim.com and compare your swims with the entire swim.com community!

Features

  • The Delphin has a small touch screen that enables you to access your favorite apps. You can navigate the touchscreen just like you would your phone. The Deluxe Bundle also contain a Bluetooth keyboard, which can be easily synced to your Delphin for even easier navigation.
  • The Delphin has up to 4 hours of battery life, outlasting your longest swim or workout. Need more battery life? You can always use the 5,000 mAh power bank included in the deluxe bundle to recharge your Delphin up to 8 times before you need to plug it in. Leave your Delphin charging in your locker between swims and only charge your Power Bank once a week!
  • The built-in clip makes it easy to attach your Delphin to your goggle strap, swimsuit, or shorts and at only 1.6 ounces, you’ll barely feel it.
  • The rubberized edges of the device are designed to be durable and withstand a rugged environment. The Delphin can be dropped, fumbled, or even thrown in the ocean.

Who should use the Delphin?

The Delphin provides a much cleaner experience for swimmers and runners. With way more storage and the ability to connect to WiFi wherever you work out, the Delphin offers much more convenience and functionality than a phone.

Swimmers and other athletes will appreciate the Delphin for acting as a tool to improve performance, endurance and speed. You can use it to stay energized and maintain focus when the pressure is on and you need to take the edge off.

Why do I need the Delphin?

If you already exercise, you probably listen to music while you run or hear the upbeat playlists blasting at your local gym. This music helps with more than just having fun or ambiance. Getting “pumped up” has real effects on the human brain.

Music helps us disassociate. When you listen to music while you exercise, disassociation helps you become less aware of the pain and the fatigue that your body experiences, enabling you to go that extra set. With swimming specifically, music can also help you synchronize your movements. When that happens, you actually use your oxygen more efficiently and give yourself a better workout.

Ultimately, music can play a key role in your results whether you exercise to recover from an injury or you train to compete in an upcoming race. The Delphin enables you to easily access all of your favorite music on a device that will not get in the way of your swim.

Underwater Audio History

Underwater Audio started five and a half years ago out of a true need for a solution. Todd hurt his back in a car accident and began swimming for physical therapy. With 25 years of experience as an engineer, he decided that there should be a better way to listen to music while you swim. He then asked his son, Scott, a marketing major at the time, to help him with his idea to start a company. They spent the last six years testing various methods to bring music underwater and make it just as easy as listening to music on your phone. After some probably not-so-safe experiments involving transmitters and water, they’ve come to the conclusion that radio waves and water don’t mix. Scott and Todd ultimately solved the problem of streaming music underwater by avoiding the issue altogether. The Delphin enables swimmers to download their music onto the device for offline listening and swim with music to their heart’s content.

Risks & Challenges

Underwater Audio has already built a working prototype of the Delphin and has begun preparing for production. We expect the Indiegogo campaign will help us better understand the demand for the Delphin and pay for production tooling.

The biggest challenge we foresee is the ability to meet the quickly growing demand for the Delphin in an organized and timely manner.

Shipping Rates

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word about the Delphin to your friends and over social media
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You can always use the 5,000 mAh power bank included in the deluxe bundle to recharge your Delphin up to 8 times before you need to plug it in. Leave your Delphin charging in your locker between swims and only charge your Power Bank once a week!
The built-in clip makes it easy to attach your Delphin to your goggle strap, swimsuit, or shorts and at only 1.6 ounces, you’ll barely feel it.
The rubberized edges of the device are designed to be durable and withstand a rugged environment. The Delphin can be dropped, fumbled, or even thrown in the ocean.


Who should use the Delphin?
The Delphin provides a much cleaner experience for swimmers and runners. With way more storage and the ability to connect to WiFi wherever you work out, the Delphin offers much more convenience and functionality than a phone.
Swimmers and other athletes will appreciate the Delphin for acting as a tool to improve performance, endurance and speed. You can use it to stay energized and maintain focus when the pressure is on and you need to take the edge off.

Why do I need the Delphin?
If you already exercise, you probably listen to music while you run or hear the upbeat playlists blasting at your local gym. This music helps with more than just having fun or ambiance. Getting “pumped up” has real effects on the human brain.
Music helps us disassociate. When you listen to music while you exercise, disassociation helps you become less aware of the pain and the fatigue that your body experiences, enabling you to go that extra set. With swimming specifically, music can also help you synchronize your movements. When that happens, you actually use your oxygen more efficiently and give yourself a better workout.
Ultimately, music can play a key role in your results whether you exercise to recover from an injury or you train to compete in an upcoming race. The Delphin enables you to easily access all of your favorite music on a device that will not get in the way of your swim.
Underwater Audio History
Underwater Audio started five and a half years ago out of a true need for a solution. Todd hurt his back in a car accident and began swimming for physical therapy. With 25 years of experience as an engineer, he decided that there should be a better way to listen to music while you swim. He then asked his son, Scott, a marketing major at the time, to help him with his idea to start a company. They spent the last six years testing various methods to bring music underwater and make it just as easy as listening to music on your phone. After some probably not-so-safe experiments involving transmitters and water, they’ve come to the conclusion that radio waves and water don’t mix. Scott and Todd ultimately solved the problem of streaming music underwater by avoiding the issue altogether. The Delphin enables swimmers to download their music onto the device for offline listening and swim with music to their heart’s content.


Risks & Challenges
Underwater Audio has already built a working prototype of the Delphin and has begun preparing for production. We expect the Indiegogo campaign will help us better understand the demand for the Delphin and pay for production tooling.
The biggest challenge we foresee is the ability to meet the quickly growing demand for the Delphin in an organized and timely manner.
Shipping Rates


 
Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Spread the word about the Delphin to your friends and over social media
Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I am looking for help for my baby sister. Carol Gallien. She endures extreme pain and serious bacterial infections cause by the lack of Lymph nodes in her right arm.

They were removed because cancer had spread. She has had 18 infections in the last 5 years and 5 just since September 2013. These Manual Lymphatic Massages are crucial for her to have a better quality of life. These infections are bacterial in nature and if allowed to spread would be catastrophic to her life.

She is unable to pay for the Lymphatic drainage massages. There is NO provincial coverage for what she needs. The massages range between $85-$100  a session plus the cost of bandages. Not to mention the numerous medications she is taking to alleviate the pain and antibiotics to fend off a more serious infection. She desperately needs to be able to function normally and not be in pain ......she was diagnosed at 31. 

Thank you everyone in advance.

Please everyone read the following: It is directly from my sister Carol......truly heartbreaking what she has had to go through


I have had 18 bouts with cellulits since 2008. 5 since sept 2013. I require ER immediately in order to have IV antibiotics for 3-5 days. The bacteria spreads very fast and creates swelling, redness, heat and extreme pain with fever and chills. I often require morphine or pain killers. I also need a epinephrine pen..epi pen as I get an anaphylactic allergic reaction to 2 of the antibiotics. The NS provincial health care does not cover MLD, manual lymphatic drainage at all. Sunlife insurance and most best health plan do not either as it falls under massages. However the province will pay for my over 100 visits to the ER and or home care from Nurses to administer my meds. This makes no sense to me. I lose work and money and worst of all my quality of life has been greatly affected by this little known or understood side affect of breast cancer and the removal of lymph nodes followed by radiation. My immune system and my lymphatic system has been greatly compromised. I appreciate your help Val. I need to have this fluid moved out of my arm as the bacteria just love this stagnant environment. Hope this helps

Chat Conversation End

Sent from Middle Sackville, Nova Scotia

Here is the conversation in french for those having difficulties with the english version


Je cherche de l'aide pour ma petite soeur . Carole Gallien . Elle endure une douleur extrême et de graves infections bactériennes provoquer par l'absence de nœuds lymphatiques dans son bras droit . Ils ont été enlevés parce que le cancer s'était propagé . Elle a eu 18 infections dans les 5 dernières années et 5 seulement depuis Septembre 2013. Ces massages lymphatique manuel sont essentiels pour elle afin d'avoir  une meilleure qualité de vie . Ces infections sont de nature bactérienne et si on les laisse se propager ceci seraient catastrophiques pour sa vie . Elle est incapable de payer pour les massages de drainage lymphatique . Il n'y a AUCUNE couverture provinciale pour ce qu'elle a besoin . Les massages varient entre $ 85 - $ 100 une session plus le coût de bandages . Sans oublier les nombreux médicaments qu'elle prend pour soulager la douleur et des antibiotiques pour parer à une infection plus grave . Elle a désespérément besoin d'être en mesure de fonctionner normalement et de ne pas être dans la douleur ...... elle a été diagnostiquée du Cancer du Sein à 31 ans. Merci à tous à l'avance. S'il vous plaît tout le monde de lire ce qui suit : Il est directement à partir de ma soeur Carole ......                                   vraiment navrant ce qu'elle a dû passer par J'ai eu 18 épisodes de cellulites depuis 2008. Déjà depuis Septembre 2013 je me suis battues avec 5. J'ai besoins de soins Urgent a l’hôpital immédiatement afin d'avoir une antibiothérapie IV pendant 3-5 jours. Les bactéries se propage très vite et crée un gonflement, de la rougeur,une douleur

extrême avec de la fièvre et des frissons . J'ai besoin souvent de la morphine ou des analgésiques . J'ai aussi besoin d'un stylo d'adrénaline .. épi pen parce que je suis très allergique a deux des antibiotiques primaire. Les soins de santé provincial de la Nouvelle- Écosse ne couvre pas les traitement donc j’ai besoins. Le Drainage Lymphatique Manuel . L’Assurance Sunlife et plusieurs plan de la santé rembourse que 300$/année. Toutefois, la province paiera pour mes plus de 100 visites à l'urgence et les soins à domicile ou de les infirmières pour administrer mes médicaments. Cela n'a pas de sens pour moi. Je perds du travail et de l'argent et le pire ma qualité de vie a été grandement affecté par ce petit côté imcompris du cancer du sein et le retrait des ganglions lymphatiques suivis par les traitements de radiotherapie . Mon système immunitaire et mon système lymphatique ont été grandement compromis. Je vous remercie de votre aide Sincerement Marie-Carole Gallien

story:
Short Summary

Struthy is half bind and it is her family disease. Her mother is suffering from the same one-eye-blindness. Her father left her mother and the two children some years back and does not provide any financial assistance. She is in High School and has her whole life ahead of her. She needs the surgery as soon as possible to prevent it from getting worse. She has acute headache problems due to this illness. 


PLEASE HELP HER!


What We Need & What You Get

Struthy is the only member of her family who can get cured. She is suffering from acute headaches and is partially blind.

We need to get her operated immediately to cure her. 

$4500 will help in her surgery and medicines. 


The Impact

Your assistance will help a little girl live a new life full of Hopes, Dreams and Happiness. You will save her from the vicious circle of blindness and poverty that her family currently endures each day.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread some awareness about this campaign.

1. Ask your friends and Family to Donate.

2. Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter and your Blog.

story:
Our healthcare system is broken. Four billion prescriptions are written each
year in the United States -- a staggering 12 prescriptions for each man, woman
and child. And yet we rank dead last in quality of health among the 17
wealthiest countries.

 

Our rates of chronic disease are epidemic. More than 70 million have prediabetes and that number will grow to 100 million by 2020. In addition, 80 million have heart disease, and whether we know it or not, someone we love is at risk for a heart attack or stroke.

What prediabetes and heart disease have in common is their cause: both are food-borne diseases. We are getting sicker by the day and there's one simple reason: we are treating the wrong thing. Instead of focusing on what people eat, our healthcare system puts people on more and more medications to counter the effects of poor diet.

At Truhealth MD, we imagine a world where physicians prescribe food
as often as they prescribe medications.

If you’ve ever questioned whether pills are too often the answer, or thought there must be a better way, please join us as we work to change the statin quo.

                          

At Truhealth MD, we have already developed a system of condition-specific
therapeutic foods to help people manage heart disease and heart disease risk factors. Now we’re developing a line of foods to help people with prediabetes halt their progression to type 2 diabetes.  There are no specific food solutions for prediabetes currently, yet every prediabetic will become a diabetic (with all the devastating complications) unless they make very specific dietary changes. 

Our pioneering foods are formulated from whole, plant-based ingredients using a unique portfolio approach to deliver therapeutic levels of fiber, antioxidants, omega-3 fatty acids and phytosterols. They are scientifically based, with more than 300 clinical trials documenting the health benefits of the ingredients.

This is not about a slightly better snack. This is about healing through food.

 

Our Step One system is designed to meet published best-practice medical care
guidelines that specify nutrition intervention as the first step in chronic disease care. And our entire approach is about great taste and maximum convenience. We spent years developing our foods and our eating system, and there is simply no other resource like this on the market. 

And guess what?  It works!  We have already seen dramatic results with the heart line among many individuals with high cholesterol. Some people have avoided cholesterol-lowering medications ("statins"), some have lowered their medication doses, some lost weight, and almost everyone felt better. And typically people saw results after only 30 days of using our products.

BUT... anecdotal evidence is not enough to convince the broad medical community to change the way it practices. Only empirical, independent scientific data will do the trick. That's why we need to confirm our preliminary results through a formal independent clinical trial. (Please scroll down to learn more about the trial itself.)

Now, you would think that there would already be thousands of published trials evaluating food interventions in treating disease.  Turns out, there are hardly any.  There’s lots of data about individual ingredients and multiple population surveys that look at average eating patterns, but almost no studies that evaluate a food-based intervention in treating or preventing disease.

We eat 3 times per day, yet we know almost nothing about the health effects
of this fundamental activity.


THE IMPACT

Our goal is not just to prove that our products work, but to shine a spotlight on a huge opportunity to change healthcare. We really are on a mission – a goal far and beyond Truhealth MD. We want doctors to prescribe food as often as they do medications. We want the healthcare community to treat the cause -- not just the symptoms -- of disease. And, together, we can lead the way! 

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Clinical trials are expensive. Very expensive. The good news is we've already raised $650,000 of the $800,000 we need to accomplish our funding goal. We have contributed our own money, have found government-backed and institutional funding, and entreated friends and family. We are close, but we need your help to get us across the finish line.

The money you donate will go to the non-profit academic institutions that will be conducting the clinical trial.  For our part, we are not only donating funds towards the trial but also all the foods that will be used in the trial.

 We appreciate any donation.  We hope you’re as excited as we are about this effort and find a perk that moves you. With your support you are not only contributing to science, but also helping to transform health care. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't contribute, you can help us spread the word. Share our campaign with your family and friends.  And if you want to learn more about what we’ve accomplished so far around heart care support, please visit our site www.steponeheart.com.

 

THE TRIAL 

If you want more details, please contact us at alldredge@truhealthmd.com but here's a little background to get you started.

The trial will be conducted over 18 months at two separate international sites, one in the US and one in Canada, and will be led by senior investigative clinicians at both institutions. The money we're raising will go directly to these non-profit investigator institutions.

The trial has two arms.

The first arm will test the effect of Truhealth MD foods on cholesterol levels in patients who are statin intolerant. This is a significant clinical issue because as many as 20% of people with cholesterol levels high enough to need medications cannot tolerate them.

The second arm will test if patients diagnosed with pre-diabetes can see improvements in their blood sugar control by eating Truhealth MD foods. This is a significant clinical issue because we know pre-diabetes leads to full-blown diabetes, and slowing or reversing that disease progression can have a tremendous impact.

The cost of the trial comes from the multiple laboratory assessments and follow-up
visits which occur during the trial, as well as the time and labor-intensive task of recruiting and screening participants.

story:
$2,500 in 25 days= 25% done!

$2,500 is our first fundraiser goal. We hope to get it within the first 25 days of announcing the project. Help us meet and even EXCEED that goal! 

So, if you see us at or above our goal on this website.... DON'T STOP GIVING! 

THERE'S SO MUCH WORK TO BE DONE!

Our total project goal is $10,000 that we need to raise before spring of 2015 to be ready by summer 2015.


"Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot..."

This is something new and big for our little camp! It's a big leap of faith, but we are passionate and ready for the challenge. Mostly, we know that camp has a beautiful community of people who love and support our work. 

So many people have been affected by camp. So many people love the work that is happening here. 

People like you!

We know you are out there and we need your help! If this camp, or ANY camp has impacted your life and you have ever wondered how you can still be involved, THIS IS YOUR CHANCE! Help be a part of this new and exciting project! Without the donations of individuals this project won't go anywhere. No donation is too large or too small!

Remember what our friend the Lorax says: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing's going to get better- its not."

Why we are so excited about tree climbing!

Camp Cherith of Western New York's mission is to transform lives, cultivate disciples, and train leaders through a Bible-based, Christ-centered outdoor camping program for children and youth. We've been instilling a love for God's creation in the minds and hearts of young people for over 65 years. 

We are looking forward to expanding our program to include Adventure Education Tree Climbing because it perfectly fits with our mission and vision for camp. Here are a few of our favorite reasons for pursing tree climbing:

  • Tree climbing is a way to get up close and personal with one of our favorite parts of God's creation.
  • Tree climbing is a great self-confidence booster and helps campers overcome fears.
  • Tree climbing provides lots of different levels of fun for campers of any age and skill level.
  • Tree climbing is a unique and memorable experience.
  • Tree climbing is incredibly fun! (Trust us- we've tried it out!)

    Our big huge goal.

    We have done our research. We realize this is a big step. We are talking to all the people we need to talk to. 

    We want this to happen.

    We want this program to be fully operational by Summer 2015.

    $10,000 will help us accomplish all the steps necessary to make this happen. The training of our lead facilitators, the prepping of the trees we are gonna be using, the gear (harnesses, ropes, carabiners, helmets, and safety gear), insurance costs, and all the other details that needs to come together.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      • Spread the word! Tell everyone you can and get people involved. Share it on Facebook and Twitter!
      • Come to our 5k and Camp Reunion on August 30th (the Saturday of Labor Day weekend). Check out our camp Facebook page for more details. 
      • Keep the project in your prayers!

Spread the word! Tell everyone you can and get people involved. Share it on Facebook and Twitter!

Come to our 5k and Camp Reunion on August 30th (the Saturday of Labor Day weekend). Check out our camp Facebook page for more details. 
Keep the project in your prayers!

story:
Keratoconus

I've had a progressive eye disease called Keratoconus for going on 3 years now. After a series of injuries including two corneal abrasions, and recurrent corneal erosions causing infection, I learned from an ophthalmologist and corneal specialist today, due to infection, emergency corneal transplants are needed for both eyes to help save my vision. I'm a 29 year old single father. I've worked with children all my life and recently graduated from Mediatech Institute ( A recording arts program). I don't have health insurance, and the surgeries will total nearly $12,000. After surgery, it will take up to 3 months for my vision to start to restore, and up to a year for my corneas to heal completely. Any contributions you're able to make, I will be very appreciative. Restoring my vision would be priceless, allowing me to start my career and have a better life for myself and my son.

The Impact

My eyes started getting worse March of 2012 after rgp contact lenses caused a very bad corneal abrasion. I've had 3 injuries, and 5 emergency visits since. From March 2012 until now my eyes have been constantly irritated and in pain. It was a struggle finishing school. I had to take a 3 month leave of absence due to the injuries and complications with my eyes. As of today emergency surgery is needed, or the Dr. fears I will lose my vision completely because of an infection they found in my left eye. It will take up to a year to recover from the corneal transplant surgeries, and will require life-long medical care. Any contributions made, even if it's $1, will be life changing for me. I'm not able to recognize my son when he's standing right in front of me. The surgeries will allow me to do a lot more with him so he can really have the chance to enjoy his childhood. He turned 5 April 10th.

Other Ways You Can Help

It is very understanble if you're unable to contribute. If you aren't able to, please share this page for me. Everyday, whenever you think about it, please help me by spreading the word about my disease and the surgeries I need to help save & restore my vision.
 
Thank you

story: My husband Hank tragically lost his life when we were hit by a truck that crossed into our lane and hit head on. Tricia Sheffield has done a lot of amazing and hard work to have a memorial party for Hank on Feb 23rd at Bamboo Bernie's. many people have been asking for a fund that they can donate to. Tricia has asked me to set up an account. All funds raised go to our family. Thank you for anyone who has donated anything. All is greatly appreciated more than you know.

story:
Short Summary

Hi I'm Alan Dunne,  I'm a personal trainer and fitness instructor. I have my own small business in Swords - Complete Body Fitness. What started as a sideline has become a real passion. I have been training people with varied and specialised needs for over 5 years now, some with Multiple Sclerosis, others with Cerebral Palsey, Parkinsons, severe Arthritis and Visual Impairment.

I have developed a specific training programme that is tailored to their particular needs, around the core issues caused by some of these health disorders and disabilities.  I've seen how my programme along with the social outlet has led to enhanced well-being for my clients.

I want to reach out to more people with various health challenges, and introduce them to the benefits of a fitness programme tailored for them.  I want to provide free fitness classes for 20 people for 10 weeks.  And I need your help to get this started.  

What I Need & What You Get

Every €1,200 I receive will help fund a term of fitness classes for 10 people, including everything to set this up, research, meet non profit organisations, do assessments,  room hire (if required), recruitment, marketing, equipment, monitoring, travel + to  help provide key supports to my funders who will make this possible. If I receive more than the target, I will add more classes, and help more people.

If you choose to support this initiative, you will be improving people's quality of life and you'll receive some gift voucher rewards that you can either use yourself or give to a friend to further thank you for your belief in this initiative.  

Rewards include Free Class Passes for my studio, Personal Training Sessions, Health eBooks, Strength & Conditioning training sessions for your team/local community team, Training sessions for your company employees and more...


The Impact

  • Exercise improves physical and mental health
  • Improve mobility (for simple things like being able to get in to their car from the passenger side if someone is blocking them in)
  • Give confidence and an opportunity to share their experiences and challenges with other people in similar health situations 


Risks & Challenges

I need to find enough people  willing to come to these classes, and convince the health and support organisations who work with them to help me do this. 

I need to convince people that this will be worth it, that the programme is personalised for them, and that it is totally suited no matter what their situation. 

Another risk is that I don't get enough money to support everyone who needs the support. I will do my best with whatever funding I receive to provide these classes for anyone who needs them..I know the impact they make. 


Early Thanks 

A huge thanks to John and Serena of www.fivepointfive.org who have helped me create this initiative and the video to support it.  They have helped many interesting initiatives around the world and their stories are really inspirational. Check it out. 
Thanks to all my funders so far. Hoping pay day brings a raft of new contributors so I can provide these classes. Thank you. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can support my project financially or not, I would love your help spreading the word.

  • Please share on facebook, twitter, email, tell your friends, anything you can do, thank you so much.

story:
IMPORTANT UPDATE: WE MIGHT HAVE REACHED THE INITIAL GOAL OF $8,000 TO BUILD THE WATER WELL IN AL YOUYA, BUT OUR LIMIT IS THE SKY BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE.. WHY NOT RAISE MORE MONEY TO BUILD ANOTHER WATER WELL AND HELP MORE AND MORE PEOPLE?? SADAGAAT IS BUILDING A NEW WATER WELL AT HASHITTI VILLAGE THAT WILL BENEFIT 480 FAMILIES (ABOUT 3,000 PEOPLE) .. LET'S HELP AS MUCH AS WE CAN.. NEW GOAL SET TO $15,000 :) LET'S MAKE IT HAPPEN PEOPLE, THESE PEOPLE TOTALLY DESERVE IT.. THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR SUPPORT :)

After the 4 amazing charity projects we have done so far during our AfriQuest, this time we set the bar very high.. What is the most important thing in life?? Water... Imagine your life without water..

According to the UN, 780 million people lack access to clean water ; approximately 1 in 9 people... Our next destination is Sudan, a country where about half the population does not have access to an improved water source, defined as a protected well, standpipe or a handpump within 1 km... scary..

In collaboration with Sadagaat Charity Association, we created the #Water4Life project, in order to build a water well that will give access to safe drinking water for Al Youya village in Barah, North Kordofan State of Sudan.. 

1,200 villagers of which approximately 300 are children, will benefit from this beautiful project!

The need for the project arises from the water shortage suffered in the overall area. Women and children need to walk very long distances to gain access to drinking water. 

The locals are mainly cattle and sheep herders and the lack of water for their herds has resulted in school aged children being sent with the herds to distant watering spots instead of them going to school.


What We Need & What You Get

Construction of the well in Al Youya Village has already begun. We are raising the remaining $8,000 to complete the well. We need to raise this amount to cover the expenses of the water tank, civil works and the solar pump. It is quite a big project and the well will be 25-30 meters deep.

Since it is nice to get something when you give your money to a project, we will reward you with some unique perks. Check out our list or even propose something that you would like to receive :)



The Impact

  • At least 1,200 villagers will gain access to clean safe drinking water
  • At least 300 school age children will have the chance to continue primary education
  • Aid in Development of the overall target area


    Risks & Challenges

    As it is not so easy to achieve something so big alone, we have created a team of passionate people that share the same values and are willing to chase this dream and make it happen!

    To see our work, you can have a look at our previous charity projects, here:

    http://www.dreamtravelive.com/p/charities.html

    and follow us on facebook : http://www.facebook.com/dreamtravelive 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Money is not everything in this life.. You can also:
      • Spread the campaign - pick up your phone and call now your grandparents, they always have some money aside :P
      • Get your family, friends, classmates, etc involved! We are talking about water guys.. we all have to give a hand!
      Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well so that more and more people get to know about the Water4Life project!

      And that's all there is to it people, 

      Let's all stand up and be living examples of the good/change we wish to see in this world :)

story:
Ladies and Gents!


Another September end and yet another Moscow marathon to come. That means that myself with all support of yours have another great opportunity to make some contribution to the society. I'm running a new campaign aiming to raise funds that will be directly transferred to Cisco covered orphanages in towns of Kashin and Rybnoe.


Please feel free to join myself and donate as you consider reasonable. Previous year we've raised 15,000 RUB which was not so bad even we had not achieved the goal figures. That money had been spent in buying New Year presents for the orphanages. Thanks much to Elena Schedrova who was coordinating this, and all you who were taking own time to drive there.

The campaign will be active within a week, the marathon is taking place this Sunday, September 20th. As previously, the Cisco t-shirt all the way. Run, Cisco, Run!


Regards.

Artem.

story:
First I would like to thank everyone for taking time to read about my cause. I know that there are alot of people out there with very valuable causes. If you can find it in your heart to donate no matter what the amount nothing is to little I would greatly appreciate it. If you can not donate would you consider helping me by passing this on to your friends and family. Thank you very much. Sharon Wright 

A Little Bit About Me

Until August of 2010 I was a very active woman, working full time at my job for over 20 years. I was very much a part of my 4 grandchildrens lives. I was very happy later to learn that I had a new granddaughter which made me 5 wonderful grandchildren. I loved to work out in my yard, work with my flowers and even cut grass. I was an on the run person.

My Disorder

In August of 2010 I started experiencing severe mucsle contractions and spasms. They started primarily with my face, neck, and back. Progression of my disorder started pretty quickly in which this happened alot more often. In January of 2011 I spent a week in the hospital (which is where this video was taken) to try to figure things out. I was told after a week that I was either faking it or I possibly had dystonia, I was told to go see a neurologist to try to find out. Little did I know that was going to be easier said than done. Dystonia effects only about 1% of the population. Through alot of work and dedication on behalf of my husband and my daughter and their relentless searching in September of 2011 I finally found my neurologist.

My Diagnosis

I was told that I had secondary cervical dystonia, secondary because it had a cause other than genetic. The cause was medication which medication remains a debate but really does not matter anymore.

Secondary Cervical Dystonia

Dystonia is a movement disorder in which your brain tells your muscles to move and contract making some muscles over active and other muscles not work at all. There are medications you can take to control the very frequent contractions and spasms which I now know are called dystonic storms. Botox can also be used, my botox has been injected into my neck muscles to help the contractions which have pulled my head off to the left side, I can not lift it or hold it up Thus causing alot of pain in my neck, head and back. The worst part of my diagnosis was being told that there is no cure only things can be tried to make my quality of life better.

Where I am Today

My head is always tilted off to the left side. The dystonia has progressed to other parts of my body also now, my left hand is closed like a fist and I can not open it, my right foot is turned inward and twisted so that if I try to walk on it I not only walk with it turned in but also on the side of it. I can only walk but a few steps at a time on my own with a cane. My left foot over the last couple of months has started to turn inward also. I am in a power wheel chair now where I spend most of my time. My first botox injection helped about 80% of the time for 5 weeks, my 2nd injection had less results and the 3rd had no good results, in fact I lost the ability to swallow food for about 2 weeks. My neurologist has suggested that I try a surgery that delivers great results in most of the patients that have this done. 

Deep Brain Stimulation

Deep brain stimulation (DBS) is essentially a pace maker for the brain. The Dr inserts wire leads with the help of a special MRI to the area of the brain in which the signals are coming from. The wire leads are later connected to a battery pack in the chest. My Dr's would adjust my settings at certain intervals until the desired setting is reached. This could possibly mean the world to me, it could give me back alot of what I have lost. The problem arises finding a Dr that can do this surgery for secondary dystonia. My current neurologist is working hard to find someone for me but it leaves me having to travel to see Dr's and alot of medical bills that are not covered by my insurance. In a couple of weeks I go to the Cleveland Clinic to see if the Dr there can do the surgery for me (I pray he can) if not I am off to Alabama to see the surgeon there. Between the surgery when I get it and the traveling I have done and will have to do, and the medical bills that my insurance HAS NOT AND WILL NOT pay for IS WHY I PRAY FOR YOUR HELP.

Imagine If You Will

All that I have lost:

constant pain, sitting is painful, being out and about in my wheel chair is painful. Any movement or no movement I make during the day is painful. I don't know what I would do without the 350 plus pills I take a month.

Not being able to get up and walk, out in the yard with the grandchildren, or even being a part of my own childrens lives in a healthy manner.

My youngest granddaughter will be 1 in a week and I have never been able to hold her on my own or even give her a proper hug.

Even taking a shower sitting down requires some recovery from the pain of making my muscles do what my brain is telling them not to do.

All of my independence, I rely on other people for most everything. There are some chores around the house that I do which I pay the price in the form of pain afterwards.

 

Perks

Unfortunately I cannot offer any perks. I am willing to keep in contact with anyone that wants to know what happens after the surgery or any updates. This really is all I have to offer.

Thank You Very Much For Whatever It Is That You Can Do To Help Me.

Sincerely Sharon Wright

My youngest granddaughter will be 1 in a week and I have never been able to hold her on my own or even give her a proper hug.
