Thank You Very Much For Whatever It Is That You Can Do To Help Me.
Sincerely Sharon Wright

story:
• Campaign Home

The Campaign

My dear friend of 13 years Sue, has recently found out that she has 2 types of aggressive stage 3 and 4 cancers, lymphoma and breast. Sue has NO Health Insurance or supplemental insurance. Sue has the state supported insurance but it doesn't cover a lot of tests and any experimental trials that she is lucky enough to be a part of. She is self-employed and if she is feeling sick or needs treatment that day, she will not get paid. I started this campaign to make sure Sue has enough money to receive the lifesaving medical treatment that she truly needs. We have all known someone who has lost a friend to cancer. Please help me not lose my friend to cancer and also, provide her with support and love through this time. It is important to let her know that she is not alone. With everyone together, we can help her be stronger than these cancers.

How You Can Help

We need to raise money to pay for medical treatments, even her basic doctor's visits. She lives in a rural area and is going to need to travel to a bigger area with more testing and treatment options due to the progressive and agressive states of her cancer. She is in desperate need for immediate treatments. As with many who are diagnosed with cancer, no one is quite sure what will be the best course of treatment for Sue or, for how long she will need treatment. We need to raise money not just for treatment but, for the times when she will most certainly not be able to work. No one needs the extra burden of running the risk of losing their home while going through various cancer treatments. Let's make sure Sue doesn't either.

 The Impact

The impact is HUGE. This is going to be a very challenging year for Sue. But she is strong; she is a fighter, and what a selfless and amazing way to show support and love. Let her know that her community and the world support her in healing. Let her know that she is not alone, that there are people she hasn't even met that are helping her heal.

 Ways You Can Help

Please, donate today! Every little bit matters. It all adds up. Think about the "little extras" we spend each day and take for granted. Maybe today, you could skip your extra latte run?  Maybe you could pool your money with friends or coworkers? Maybe you could collect your loose change as a school charity project? Maybe you could hold a hair auction and see how much you could raise if you shaved your head? There are lots of things you can do to help, some big, some small but, all make a difference, no matter the size of the gesture. If you want to help but, you are unable to donate financially, there are still many ways to support Sue's healing process, no matter what your faith, prayers and healing thoughts are always good and most sincerely needed. If you live close by you could stop by with some cancer friendly food or offer to feed her horses. Maybe you could just bring her some tea and give her a hug, let her know she's supported and loved.

 Thank you for your support and love,

<3 Kamae Risher
story_txt:
Campaign Home

The Campaign
My dear friend of 13 years Sue, has recently found out that she has 2 types of aggressive stage 3 and 4 cancers, lymphoma and breast. Sue has NO Health Insurance or supplemental insurance. Sue has the state supported insurance but it doesn't cover a lot of tests and any experimental trials that she is lucky enough to be a part of. She is self-employed and if she is feeling sick or needs treatment that day, she will not get paid. I started this campaign to make sure Sue has enough money to receive the lifesaving medical treatment that she truly needs. We have all known someone who has lost a friend to cancer. Please help me not lose my friend to cancer and also, provide her with support and love through this time. It is important to let her know that she is not alone. With everyone together, we can help her be stronger than these cancers.
How You Can Help
We need to raise money to pay for medical treatments, even her basic doctor's visits. She lives in a rural area and is going to need to travel to a bigger area with more testing and treatment options due to the progressive and agressive states of her cancer. She is in desperate need for immediate treatments. As with many who are diagnosed with cancer, no one is quite sure what will be the best course of treatment for Sue or, for how long she will need treatment. We need to raise money not just for treatment but, for the times when she will most certainly not be able to work. No one needs the extra burden of running the risk of losing their home while going through various cancer treatments. Let's make sure Sue doesn't either.
 The Impact
The impact is HUGE. This is going to be a very challenging year for Sue. But she is strong; she is a fighter, and what a selfless and amazing way to show support and love. Let her know that her community and the world support her in healing. Let her know that she is not alone, that there are people she hasn't even met that are helping her heal.
 Ways You Can Help
Please, donate today! Every little bit matters. It all adds up. Think about the "little extras" we spend each day and take for granted. Maybe today, you could skip your extra latte run?  Maybe you could pool your money with friends or coworkers? Maybe you could collect your loose change as a school charity project? Maybe you could hold a hair auction and see how much you could raise if you shaved your head? There are lots of things you can do to help, some big, some small but, all make a difference, no matter the size of the gesture. If you want to help but, you are unable to donate financially, there are still many ways to support Sue's healing process, no matter what your faith, prayers and healing thoughts are always good and most sincerely needed. If you live close by you could stop by with some cancer friendly food or offer to feed her horses. Maybe you could just bring her some tea and give her a hug, let her know she's supported and loved.
 Thank you for your support and love,
<3 Kamae Risher

story:
The Cause  

My name is Lisa Kende and I have known Fr. Andrew Recepcion from the Philippines for many years. When Typhoon Yolanda struck his country last month, I reached out to him to learn that he nearly lost his life. As he shared about the enormous loss of life and severe property damage that he witnessed, I was moved to initiate this campaign to help him to help those who are suffering. 

EVERY DOLLAR CONTRIBUTED WILL BE USED TO FEED and REBUILD HOMES FOR VICTIMS OF THE TYPHOON and CLASSROOMS FOR CHILDREN.

What Each Dollar Buys

  • $ 25 can buy 55 lbs of rice, enough to feed 100 people
  • $ 50 can buy 8 bags of cement for foundations
  • $ 75 can buy 800 square feet of plywood to erect walls
  • $ 100 can buy 5 metal sheets of roofing material  
  • $150 can buy enough Christmas Eve meals to feed 10 families in Leyte. Noche Bueno, meaning Good or Holy Night is a Filipino custom referring to the meal served late on Christmas Eve, usually after midnight mass.
  • $5,000 can go towards the $20,000 cost of building a classroom for 40 - 50 children and would go directly to the department of education 
  • $5,000 can be given to a local agency like a church-based outreach committee that has already started rebuilding homes for the homeless. 

All contributions go directly to the homeless and hungry displaced from the typhoon through the Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines (CBCP), a non-profit, caring for those in the areas hardest hit by the typhoon. 

The Impact 

During this Christmas and Hanukah season, a time of gift giving, even your small contribution can make a huge difference to a family that has lost everything. Your contribution also offers hope to those who face months, even years of recovering from a storm far worse than any we've ever known here in the U.S.

Fr. Andrew has experience and a fine track record in building very simple and cost-effective shelters for the poorest in the Philippines and he is familiar with the areas hardest hit by Yolanda and knows exactly how and where all contributions can be spent immediately and without needless bureaucracy or extra costs to make the greatest difference for families who cannot survive without outside intervention and aid.

It is our sincere hope that this campaign will raise much more than $5,000 given the enormous task of providing the very minimum for those suffering at this time.

SUMMARY

As I watched news reports on the path and destruction caused by Typhoon Yolanda, described by CNN as "the strongest storm ever to make landfall in recorded history", concerned for the safety of those we know in the Philippines, I reached out to two very special priests, relieved to learn that both were safe. However one of them, Fr. Andrew Recepcion, was in the direct path of the storm and nearly lost his life.

He wrote:  "I am finally in Cebu after boarding a military plane from Tacloban Leyte. I almost died in the typhoon. I thought we would not survive. I walked for 24 kilometers to get to the airport passing through dead bodies, chaos, looting, and houses and properties that were totally destroyed and could not keep my tears  not knowing how the people of Leyte can rebuild their lives again. Thank you for those who prayed for me and the people of Leyte. Let us all help them in many ways that we can. The church in Leyte is very much in touch with local people so channeling help through the Archdiocese of Palo, Leyte by way of The Catholic Bishops' Conference of the Philippines will make things faster."

About Fr. Andrew

Fr. Andrew, a man of enormous character, determination and empathy for others, has been actively involved in building shelters for the homeless who live in and around the garbage dumps in the Philippines. He has also long been involved in the Focolare Movement, an ecumenical international organization that promotes the ideals of unity and universal brotherhood to people of all faiths as well as the non-religious. Fr. Andrew has also been blessed with a wonderful singing voice that lifts the spirits of all who hear it.

The Typhoon 

Typhoon Yolanda ravaged the Phillipines on November 8, 2013. Thousands of lives were lost and tens of thousands remain homeless and in dire need of help.  

The facts: 

  • The Manila Times predicts the death toll could soar well over 10,000, with nearly 1,800 people still missing. 3.54 million people have been displaced by Yolanda, the country’s worst recorded natural disaster.

  • US military's Typhoon Warning Center recorded sustained winds of nearly 200 miles/hour, equivalent to a category 5 hurricane.
  • The city of Tacloban and outlying provinces of Leyte and Samar, were directly in the path of Yolanda. Devastating winds and two-story high mountainous tsunami-like waves destroyed much of the Tacloban peninsula and reducing entire communities of wooden homes to wet pulp as bodies lay dead in the streets.  

  • Underestimating Yolanda's force, officials stocked far too few emergency supplies for residents to survive. For example, the 800 five-gallon jugs of water was only enough to sustain less than 2% of the city's population for 24 hours after the storm.          
  • The majority of those in the storm's path are in dire need of outside assistance for their very survival.  For a timeline of the storm's destruction click here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help by sharing this campaign with others who may be able to make a small contribution.  No contribution either of treasure or time is too small to make a difference in the life of a brother or sister who is suffering. We are all diminished by the pain and suffering of every child or family that hopes to be remembered in this time of need. Fr. Andrew thanks you for your help.

Giving Tuesday - Dec 3, 2013 

Giving Tuesday was implemented last year by the United Nations to encourage on-line charitable contributions.  On this day, Indiegogo will contribute $1 for every $20 that this campaign raises. If you plan to give, please do so on December 3 if at all possible.

story:
Our Story

The Aquile (Eagles) Ferrara are one of the oldest American football team in Italy and certainly the one with the longest tradition. The club includes youth programs, cheerleaders, a senior level group and a female tackle team. The majority of the teams in Italy do not have facilities and a stadium.  Practices and home games are hosted in soccer fields, but few months ago, after more than 35 years of battles, finally the Aquile obtained  their own football field ! Thanks to the efforts and support of our fans, players and coaches,  we were able to renovate the locker rooms, to build a small gym and install two side sections of the stands, but now we need your help to complete central sector. 

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will be used to dismiss the old and unsafe concrete grandstand and built a new one. To do so we need to raise 20,000 USD. The more funding we receive,  the  higher, nicer and modern the new stand will be ! As a reward you will get an unique perk !

Your contribution will help current and future generations to play in a safe and modern environment. The Mike Wyatt Field, is more than a stadium, it is a home, where players, parents and fan can gather together. A place thought just for football, american football.

We have chosen a flexible funding with the hope that brick by brick we will be able to reach our goal. Our enthusiasm is for free and it is the best foundation for the new stands. We are determined to reach our goal no matter how long it will take. The Aquile is a non-profit organization, the money we will receive will be spent in this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, help us to spread our campaign. Make some noise amongst your community, tell friends and relatives. Follow the campaign on Indiegogo, on our Facebook page and on Twitter. Grazie mille !

story:
Who are we?

We are Rearguard, a start up in Taiwan, Taipei on a mission to deliver better head protection in HEMA and other combat sports in need of good masks. Our vision is to provide a safe, affordable mask that will last, and that offers better protection to the head and neck than other masks on the market.

Rearguard pre-production sample

Why Rearguard?

Concussions are becoming an increasing concern in  HEMA. Keith Farrell's paper "Dementia Pugilistica in HEMA: Brain Damage from Repeated Head Hits", is a sobering read. It is widely recognized that the various HEMA back of head protection solutions currently available all have serious drawbacks, and that some of them provide only nominal protection. Several online videos show HEMA fencers being concussed by strikes to the rear of the skull (occipital region), despite wearing widely used back of head protectors costing more than US$60. We need something better.

How is Rearguard different?

Rearguard is the first HEMA specific mask with integral occipital protection. Current back of head protection typically involves solutions that are:

  • Soft or only semi-rigid, providing little or no impact protection
  • Not integral to the mask
  • Incompatible with good mobility
  • Only compatible with some masks
  • Heavy heat traps

Rearguard's key features are:

  • Steel mesh occipital protection integral to the mask, offering unparalleled rigid protection with low weight and good ventilation
  • A rigid nape protector (standard for all models), made by Neyman Fencing
  • Steel bars underneath the front of the mask to protect from heavy overhead blows (Advance & Premium models only)
  • Competitive retail price at 150$ (even lower when buying from our campaign)
  • CEN 2 mesh
  • 1600N bib


Rearguard gives you unique options

Rearguard offers a combination of features without peer in the market, with greater protection and convenience at a lower price point than anything else you can buy.The following optional features are also available for Rearguard.

  • Steel plates (removable), to protect the forehead mesh from repeated strikes
  • 800N aventail (removable), with rigid throat protection
  • Superior mask liner (removable), with  anti-impact padding that can replace a rugby cap
  • Deluxe mask liner (removable). with anti-impact padding & high breathability fabric for long term comfort

Our good friends at Neyman Fencing are developing the aventail, nape protection and  mask liners.

Rearguard pre-production sample

Rearguard in action

Rearguard fits without getting in the way of your glasses.

See how well Rearguard stands up to heavy feder strikes.

Available models

Through our Indiegogo campaign pricing, Rearguard offers more options at a lower price than most popular alternatives.

Risk & challenges

Our mask is already in production.  The factory is in China, but has FIE certification, and Rearguard will carry FIE and CE certification. The factory has an excellent reputation, and produces masks for the German fencing company Allstar. The only risk we face is a possible extension of the completion date. Masks ordered through our Indiegogo campaign should be completed at the end of April, for shipping in May.

These images show a Rearguard mask in various stages of production at the factory.

story:
The Orangeville Banner Newspaper- Sports

Article Headline- Writer Changing how Women golf

 

Strings of Pearls, Golf Goddess Yoga World Tours; Women going on a Spiritual Golf Quest together.

 

 

This Campaign is Complete

 

 

 

Follow the Journey and the Movement.

https://golfgoddess.wordpress.com/

 

The strings of Pearls between Mother Earth, Golf, Yoga and the Goddesses
 

 

 

"Golfing Goddesses"  It's all about Connecting

 

Connect with Nature through Golf.

Connect with Yoga to Improve Golf.

 Connect to the Goddesses to understand Nature.

Connect with Women in sacred space to understand the Goddesses. 

Connect it all together for Awakening Spiritual Growth, to experience Magical golf games and lives.

 

 

 

Are you seeking to Travel? To have a more passionate, playful, prayerful life? You can have these with a unique Heart-centered way to connect with women and nature, using the venue of golf...the game like you have never encountered before.

           

LETS IGNITE GOLFING GODDESSES TO GET GOING AND CAMERAS ROLLING!

 

 We invite women who want to play in a new way, in a more connected, peaceful, passionate way of playing, tailored just for them.  The Golf Goddess way offers pearls of wisdom stringing together what we have learned by playing in deep connection. We have seen what women are yearning for, its connection; to sisterhood, the earth, animals, the elements, to their own heart and intuition, Connection with a Higher Source to guide them. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This is a Nine Year Commitment of Author Margarit Brigham and Partners, e

xploring the world through the Nine Ancient Goddesses from the Chapters in her book;

 

 "How to Become a Golf Goddess;" 'Connect to your inner Core with yoga for golf and so much more.'  

                                                   Find the book on Amazon

 

                                             

 

 

 

 

Come with us on this Journey that begins in Africa                            with the Goddess Oya.  

 

 

 

                             Africa Feb. 2016 

 

 

                        **Details under Perks or visit the website***

                           http://golfinggoddesses.com/tour.hrml

 

   

              The Core teachings are the same in all Venues

 


   How to play golf more from the Heart space, than the Head! 

 

 

Q. What does Golf Goddess Yoga entail?

 

 

 

 

We will  be using transmedia storytelling, that is, pictures, videos, podcasts, blog posts,  to share the story of how to Play in partnership, co-operation and connection with nature and community. Women raising each other up with Transformative golf; unplug, reconnect with nature and community. 

 
The Team

 

 

 

 

 

Margarit Brigham

Main Facilitator 

Author, Yoga Teacher, Spiritual Golf Coach, Goddess Mentor

This has been a 20 year evolution that began as Yoga for Golf to becoming an Author and creator of a new program, Golf Goddess Yoga, to coaching, to now travelling. 

My deepest desire is spread this beauty way path, to other women, Through film and photos, showing how women and girls can conceptualize the meaning of true sisterhood, that will enrich their lives, and the lives around them. 

Meet my Dream Team, that said Yes in 2015!!  To an expanded Vision  to Make the first spiritual women and golf documentary to reach millions of lives. These two women whom, I have had the privilege to grow with in supportive, nurturing, women's circles for the past 18 years, are the perfect fit to co-create with the Divine Feminine.  

 

Read more about Margarit at the top of the page under, See more Details.

 

 

 

 

Georgina Longbottom

Co-Facilitator 

Golfer, Massage therapist, Goddess Mentor, and Co-leader in  Golf Goddess Yoga Workshops and Clinics, as well as tour guide,

She offers 27 years of massage experience working with clients from infant to 92 years of age. She is a holistic practioner also trained in reflexology, homeopathy, shiatsu and touch for health. As well as completing a three year study in Somatic Psychotherapy and seven years of group dynamic therapies.

She is a Spiritual mentor with 16 years of women's circles, sweat lodges and spiritual practices which have enriched the focus of body, mind and spirit healing.

 

               

 

Ila Sission

Photographer , Co-Facilitator 

A gifted artist, Ila has had a lifelong passion for photography. She has travelled the Americas with camera in hand. Her photos express a sense of order and serenity that fill a need in this fast changing world. As you view her photographs you will be moved by her awareness of the beauty of the natural world and her vision, captured through the lens.

Tour through the gallery http://www.touchedbylight.ca/gallery.html

 

Ila along with her husband, have held Sacred Fires on their property leading Ceremony for Community for decades. Ila began leading Full Moon Ceremonies where myself and Georgina first met Ila 16 years ago. It is thanks to her and the local women that we have learned how to lead and have true Sisterhood relationships. Ila also leads drum making workshops and sweat lodges and offers many diverse spiritual practices which have enriched the focus of body, mind and spirit healing.

 

Leon Graafland 

 

Independent Travel Consultant with Merit Travel

 

We are very fortunate to have teamed up with another visionary who is in the travel industry. A tour guide for many years himself before becoming an consultant. 

 

 

 

What We Need

 Get golfing goddesses going and Cameras Rolling!

 

 

Step 1. We are raising funds to bring our professional photographer Ila Sission on location with us.  To pay for her Airfare, Accommodations and meals.

 

Step 2. We need to purchase new technology in camera, video recorded, new phones so we can start instagram accounts to Document the Tours.

Step 3. The rest is for administration of Indiegogo

Funding Breakdown

To make this Documentary to a high standard, we require the following funding:

  • The equipment cost $5000.00
  • Travel costs for Professional to Africa - $7000.00
  • Development/Director: $500.00
  • Filming and Editing $1000.00
  • Admin for Indiegogo, guessetment $150.00
  • Unforseeables....3000.00 airfare taxes, travel insurance, rental car ..etc

 

 

 

What You Get- The Perks 

Enrich your life with a perk as a thank you gift for you contribution.
 

 

 

Donations of $5.00 - $25.00 Meditation and Visualization Mp3's

 

 

Books - $30.00 or $50.00
Plus above perk

Autographed copy, How to Become a Golf Goddess 
Ebook, How to Become a Golf Goddess
Ebook, A Magical golf game

 

 

Golf Goddess Coaching $150.00

With varitey of above perks

Updates and Your Name in the documentary 

 

12 women can experience  Africa Trip Feb. 2016  $2990.00

 

Play golf and do yoga like a Goddess in Africa!

Honouring the African Goddess Oya in the Golf Goddess book, she is under Chapters Transformation and Confidence.

Oya is recognized as a Patron for women.

 

 

 

At Hans Merensky Hotel & Spa, you will experience golfing like no other place. With the world renowned Kruger National Park bordering this exquisite Championship golf course, visitor from the African Wild can very likely be expected.

http://www.hansmerensky.com/

 

The Impact

Why do we recommend Women Play golf as a spiritual adventure?
Play your Way into your Purpose!

 

  • Its Good For your Health

It reconnects One to Nature, and a the Sense of wonder.

Also the healing and repairing of being outside and in golf you can be outdoors for 2 playing 9 holes or 4 hours playing 18 holes.


Clinical studies have proven that 2 hours of nature sounds a day significantly reduces stress hormones up to 800% and activates 500-600 DNA segments known to be responsible for healing and repairing the body.

                                              

HEARTS ON FIRE

Reconnecting Women back to a Sacred Union with Nature, bringing them more to their hearts and to a Personal Experience of the Goddesses in many cultures, using the venue of Golf!

Risks & Challenges

 

Where there is a daring and ambitious idea, risks and challenges follow. 

Risks. Traveling to overseas  with expensive equipment increases the chance of theft, robbery, etc., 

Beyond this, other risks include disease, illness.


Challenges. The amount of content to produce, organize, and publicize is– well, it's a lot.  My resolve may be tested, but after decades of commitment,and almost dying with my dream still inside me, this has prepared me mentally and physically for those very uncomfortable circumstances. 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

     

    A little of your time is a valuable contribution alone:

    • Using your Facebook, Twitter, Goggle+ Pinterest, and other social media platforms to spread the word expands our audience and number of potential supporters! 
    • Good 'ol fashion "word of mouth" also increases our reach! 

    More creative ways to support: 
     

    • I'm interested in collaborating with other female golfers and golf media . Let's talk and collaborate! 

     

    HELP MAKE IT HAPPEN. NAMASTE.
story_txt:
The Orangeville Banner Newspaper- Sports
Article Headline- Writer Changing how Women golf
 
Strings of Pearls, Golf Goddess Yoga World Tours; Women going on a Spiritual Golf Quest together.
 
 

This Campaign is Complete
 
 
 

Follow the Journey and the Movement.

https://golfgoddess.wordpress.com/
 

The strings of Pearls between Mother Earth, Golf, Yoga and the Goddesses 
 

 
"Golfing Goddesses"  It's all about Connecting Connect with Nature through Golf.
Connect with Yoga to Improve Golf.
 Connect to the Goddesses to understand Nature.
Connect with Women in sacred space to understand the Goddesses. 
Connect it all together for Awakening Spiritual Growth, to experience Magical golf games and lives.
 
 
 
Are you seeking to Travel? To have a more passionate, playful, prayerful life? You can have these with a unique Heart-centered way to connect with women and nature, using the venue of golf...the game like you have never encountered before.
           
LETS IGNITE GOLFING GODDESSES TO GET GOING AND CAMERAS ROLLING!  We invite women who want to play in a new way, in a more connected, peaceful, passionate way of playing, tailored just for them.  The Golf Goddess way offers pearls of wisdom stringing together what we have learned by playing in deep connection. We have seen what women are yearning for, its connection; to sisterhood, the earth, animals, the elements, to their own heart and intuition, Connection with a Higher Source to guide them. 
 

 
 
   
This is a Nine Year Commitment of Author Margarit Brigham and Partners, exploring the world through the Nine Ancient Goddesses from the Chapters in her book;
  "How to Become a Golf Goddess;" 'Connect to your inner Core with yoga for golf and so much more.'  
                                                   Find the book on Amazon
 
                                             
 
 
 
 
Come with us on this Journey that begins in Africa                            with the Goddess Oya.  
   
                             Africa Feb. 2016 
 
                         **Details under Perks or visit the website***                           http://golfinggoddesses.com/tour.hrml                  The Core teachings are the same in all Venues    How to play golf more from the Heart space, than the Head! 
 


 
Q. What does Golf Goddess Yoga entail?


 
 


 
 
We will  be using transmedia storytelling, that is, pictures, videos, podcasts, blog posts,  to share the story of how to Play in partnership, co-operation and connection with nature and community. Women raising each other up with Transformative golf; unplug, reconnect with nature and community. 
 The Team     Margarit BrighamMain Facilitator Author, Yoga Teacher, Spiritual Golf Coach, Goddess MentorThis has been a 20 year evolution that began as Yoga for Golf to becoming an Author and creator of a new program, Golf Goddess Yoga, to coaching, to now travelling. My deepest desire is spread this beauty way path, to other women, Through film and photos, showing how women and girls can conceptualize the meaning of true sisterhood, that will enrich their lives, and the lives around them. 
Meet my Dream Team, that said Yes in 2015!!  To an expanded Vision  to Make the first spiritual women and golf documentary to reach millions of lives. These two women whom, I have had the privilege to grow with in supportive, nurturing, women's circles for the past 18 years, are the perfect fit to co-create with the Divine Feminine.  
 
Read more about Margarit at the top of the page under, See more Details.  
 
 

Georgina Longbottom
Co-Facilitator 
Golfer, Massage therapist, Goddess Mentor, and Co-leader in  Golf Goddess Yoga Workshops and Clinics, as well as tour guide,
She offers 27 years of massage experience working with clients from infant to 92 years of age. She is a holistic practioner also trained in reflexology, homeopathy, shiatsu and touch for health. As well as completing a three year study in Somatic Psychotherapy and seven years of group dynamic therapies. 
She is a Spiritual mentor with 16 years of women's circles, sweat lodges and spiritual practices which have enriched the focus of body, mind and spirit healing.
 
               
 


Ila Sission


Photographer , Co-Facilitator 
A gifted artist, Ila has had a lifelong passion for photography. She has travelled the Americas with camera in hand. Her photos express a sense of order and serenity that fill a need in this fast changing world. As you view her photographs you will be moved by her awareness of the beauty of the natural world and her vision, captured through the lens.Tour through the gallery http://www.touchedbylight.ca/gallery.html

 
Ila along with her husband, have held Sacred Fires on their property leading Ceremony for Community for decades. Ila began leading Full Moon Ceremonies where myself and Georgina first met Ila 16 years ago. It is thanks to her and the local women that we have learned how to lead and have true Sisterhood relationships. Ila also leads drum making workshops and sweat lodges and offers many diverse spiritual practices which have enriched the focus of body, mind and spirit healing.

 
Leon Graafland 
 
Independent Travel Consultant with Merit Travel
 

We are very fortunate to have teamed up with another visionary who is in the travel industry. A tour guide for many years himself before becoming an consultant.   
 
What We Need
 Get golfing goddesses going and Cameras Rolling!

 
 
Step 1. We are raising funds to bring our professional photographer Ila Sission on location with us.  To pay for her Airfare, Accommodations and meals. 

 Step 2. We need to purchase new technology in camera, video recorded, new phones so we can start instagram accounts to Document the Tours.
Step 3. The rest is for administration of Indiegogo
Funding Breakdown
To make this Documentary to a high standard, we require the following funding:

The equipment cost $5000.00
Travel costs for Professional to Africa - $7000.00
Development/Director: $500.00
Filming and Editing $1000.00
Admin for Indiegogo, guessetment $150.00

Using your Facebook, Twitter, Goggle+ Pinterest, and other social media platforms to spread the word expands our audience and number of potential supporters!

I'm interested in collaborating with other female golfers and golf media . Let's talk and collaborate!

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Joop Stringer (49), living in the Netherlands.
At this moment IT project manager and studying to become a Chiropractor.

Loving father of 2 kids, Kimberley (20) and Dennis (18) and in love with a beatiful girl Helena.

In short: I'm fighting cancer on a natural way and need funding to go to Germany for treatment with dendritic cells and hyperthermia.

It has proven succesful for me over the past year !

 

The long story

My story starts in 2009 when a testical cancer was found and I had to undergo surgery. After surgery they advised me to have chemo to be sure everythig was gone.... and so I did.

Went into the check-up routine and had a scan every half year.

In november 2011 the hammer hit me again ... they found a tumor of 4cm and one of 13mm on a lymphnode near my left kidney. The only remedy they offered was a 9 week full-time chemo treatment.

I refused and went on finding my way in natural treatment.
And so I found the dendritic cell therapy of Dr. Rober Gorter in Medical Center Cologne in Germany.

This is a combination therapy of hyperthermia (creating fever in your body) and "implementing" new dendritic cells grown from my own blood.

After 3 months, I went 2 times a week to Cologne, 24 treatments with local hyperthermia and 8 dendritic cell treatments in combination with total body hyperthermia, the tumor which was 4cm stopt growing.

The 7 months after that, I only could visit MCC twice, the small tumor grew a feww millimeters.

The last 3 months, I was not able to go to MCC, due to lack of funding, the scan showed 3 NEW tumors.

The Impact

If I can get this funding, I'll be able to go to MCC again on a regualr base and am sure I'll be able to stop the tumors to grow further and even shrink them !!

If not : I must probably undergo chemotherapy (BEP cure) with all the consequences: ie severe cardiovascular problems, broken down immune system and other physical troubles.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please like my facebook page and share it among your family, friends and relatives:

view my facebook: http://facebook.com/10voorJoop

or view my blog: http://10voorJoop.blogspot.com

story: Tony lived in Kennebunkport with his brother, mother and stepfather. He was in a accident riding a moped and after returning home to recover, suffered a blood clot in his lung. When they decided to try an operation to remove the clot, something went wrong. Anthony was 27 and left a huge impression on so many people. He was well known and well loved in the community. The loss of him was unexpected because he originally  was recovering from a broken leg and arm, and a ruptured bladder. The money we are raising will assist his family with medical bills and everyday bills. Anything you feel like you can donate is greatly appriciated. Thanks

story:
Please visit our new Indiegogo fundraiser at Dr. Neuhaus

Photo credit: Stuart Productions. Originally published in the Huffington Post.
This is what the war on abortion access looks like in Kansas: betraying the confidence of medical patients, pretending that forcing 10 year olds to birth rapists' babies is no big deal, bankrupting doctors, driving one man into a frenzy of anti-choice hate so much so that he murders someone, and allowing convicted terrorists to run the whole thing.

The Deeply Disturbing World of Modern Day Anti-Abortion Activism

Amanda Marcotte, RH Reality Check


You would not think, for example, that a convicted clinic bomber would have a lot of traction with a state medical board. In Kansas, however, Cheryl Sullenger was able to set in motion a case against Dr. Tiller’s former colleague, Dr. Ann Kristin Neuhaus, that in 2012 took away her license to practice medicine, and has driven her to the brink of financial ruin, and may well stick her with the entire cost of the proceedings against her—a whopping $92,672—should she lose her appeal. Was Sullenger a patient of Dr. Neuhaus who had been injured? The parent or spouse of one? No. She is a senior policy adviser to Operation Rescue who served two years in prison for trying to blow up a clinic in California in 1987, and whose phone number was found in the car of Dr. Tiller’s assassin, Scott Roeder. In Kansas, you see, anyone can bring a case against any doctor, and the anti-choice movement takes full advantage of that legal quirk. And so it came about that the clinic bomber drove a compassionate, caring doctor out of medicine and into near-bankruptcy.

Operation Rescue vs. Dr. Ann Neuhaus, Hero Provider 

Katha Pollitt, The Nation

WHY THE $92,672 CAMPAIGN GOAL? 

Dr. Ann Kristin Neuhaus, a former associate of murdered Kansas abortion doctor George Tiller, has for years been paying the price for her commitment to a woman's right to a safe, legal abortion: death threats, having to go to work wearing a bullet-proof vest, even at one point carrying a gun.

Because of that commitment, the Operation Rescue fanatics in Kansas, with the help of a craven bunch of Republican charlatans in state government, have successfully revoked her medical license, and are now seeking to sock her and her family with the bill for all the "court costs" of the kangaroo-court-like "hearing" by the Kansas Board of Healing Arts whose stacked members stole her hard-earned right to practice medicine.

The bill for this legal lynching: $92,000.

Hounded by Kansas Political Hacks and Anti-abortion Fanatics, A Hero Needs Support

Dave Lindorff, This Can't Be Happening!

The $92,672 campaign goal is symbolic and personal. It is the amount the State of Kansas is seeking to collect for the Kansas State Board of Healing Arts (KSBHA) from me after a highly prejudiced political inquisition. Four of the 9 practicing physicians on the board recused themselves from this judgement against me, but many who are political appointments of Gov. Sam Brownback, are not qualified medical professionals and have taken anti-abortion so-called "pro-life" public positions. To see a list of the members for yourself, click here.

I practiced for years, serving thousands of patients as a family physician before 1991. After the 1991 so-called "Summer of Mercy" in Wichita, Ks. I helped several doctors who were being victimized for performing abortions in Kansas.

Years later, after performing nearly 10,000 pregnancy terminations and providing the state-mandated 2nd opinion for patients of the late Dr. George Tiller, KSBHA lawyers and investigators did what their terrorist sympathizers couldn't - financially destroyed me and my family.

WHAT YOUR DONATION WILL DO IN KANSAS

Some members and employees of KSBHA, Gov. Sam Brownback and a large number of legislators are determined to outlaw safe, legal and clean reproductive health choices for women in Kansas.

Your donation, and the successful culmination of this fundraiser to restore our 10 acre family farm, will send a powerful message for reproductive choice to lawmakers, religious zealots and their terrorist sympathizers in Kansas. A similar life-long message of hope and renewal I gave nearly 10,000 women in my career before being targeted and financially ruined.

I have been persecuted, stalked and the victim of domestic terror campaigns by both the public and underground anti-abortion political groups in Kansas and nationwide. The rate of KSBHA investigations of those providing pregnancy termination is around 50% or higher. For non-providers, it is less than 1%, an astronomical difference and clear evidence of a long-standing prejudicial pattern of administrative practices by the Kansas medical board.

None of my patients have been injured or are party to the complaints filed against me, Instead KSBHA used a complaint filed by a convicted clinic bombing conspirator (one of many of hers that they have pursued over the years) to destroy my career and force my family into bankruptcy.

You can read all the court transcripts, including the former Kansas Attorney General Phil Kline's secret "Inquisition" (yes, that is the official term) against Dr. Tiller at my husband's Welcome to Brownbackistan blog. The itemized bill, including the doughnuts, meals and hotel expenses their "expert" witness incurred are linked here.

My family needs this money to save our run-down 96 year old farmhouse.

Thank you so much for sharing our concern about the fate of women in 21st Century Kansas, and indeed in much of the United States, 40 years post-Roe v. Wade.

Finally, please read this terrifying accounting by Jessica Valenti, writer for The Nation, and ask yourself, what kind of country have we become?

       Kris Neuhaus, MD, MPH


ARTICLES & EDITORIALS ABOUT MY REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH CARE WORK IN KANSAS:

Former colleague of abortion doctor Tiller blames state for his death, by Scott Rothschild, Lawrence Journal World, Lawrence, KS Oct. 30, 2011.

Kansas Medical Board Investigates Dr. George Tillers' Colleague, by Kate Sheppard, Mother Jones Magazine, Nov. 3, 2011.

No Healing: The State of Kansas is still chasing one of the last links to Dr. George Tiller, by Justin Kendall, The Pitch Weekly, Kansas City, MO, Nov. 29, 2011.

The Witch Burners Are Alive and Sick in Kansas, 'Stand Up for Dr. Neuhaus Against Kansas Theocracy & Anti-abortion Jihad, by Dave Lindorff, This Can't Be Happening! On-line News Collective, March 3, 2012 (reprinted in Counterpunch)

Ann Kristin Neuhaus, Doctor And Tiller Colleague, Is The Latest Casualty In Kansas Abortion War, by Hunter Stuart, Huffington Post, Aug. 16, 2013.

Fundraising Campaign Aims to Pay Former Abortion Doctor Ann Kristin Neuhaus' $93,000 Trial Bill, by Hunter Stuart, Huffington Post, Aug. 30, 2013.

Hounded by Kansas Political Hacks and And Anti-Abortion Fanatics, a Hero Needs Support, by Dave Lindorff, This Can't Be Happening! On-line News Collective, Sept. 1, 2013.

"I've had enough. If I had to do it again, I wouldn't do it without an army."

story:
Short Summary

We are the GrassROOTS Community Foundation and we are raising funds to support our summer camp for girls of African ancestry. Super Camp is an innovative summer that teaches girls leadership skills and improves their well-being. Most children lose two months of learning during the summer. Super Camp makes improves learning by making learning fun. We teach children yoga, science, dance, math, and history.

What We Need & What You Get

We have raised $20K so far, but we need $10k more to meet our goals

  • Girls travel to New York and Philadelphia to meet with Black women who are trailblazers in the fields of Finance, Arts, Science & Technology (F.A.S.T.).
  • We need funds to pay for reliable transportation to take girls on field trips
  • We need funds to pay for swimming instruction. Every girl needs to know this important life lesson.
  • We need funds to support families in need. Each family receives some financial support.
  • Eating healthy matters.  We need funds to pay for the fresh fruit and veggies girls eat daily. Fresh fruit and veggies are available throughout the day for Campers to take at any time.

The Impact

Super Camp celebrates girlhood in its different form. We connect our girls to their African and family heritage because we know that understanding history protects them from many social ills. Girls with a strong sense of history do better in schools, have greater levels of confidence and have delayed sexual initiation.

We teach our girls how to stay physically well by engaging them in daily physical fitness and in dance because we know obesity is a problem in our communities.

We teach our girls how to value themselves and express their feelings because we know that these skills will help them better negotiate the challenges they will face in life.

We connect our girls with women mentors and Trailblazers because we know our girls are overexposed to service professions and those jobs will not allow them economic freedom. Connection with Trailblazers creates a pathway for them to lead.

Risks & Challenges

As doctorate level scholars and teachers, we have over four decade worth of experiences working with families, particularly women and girls. Our plan is to teach these girls the skills necessary for them to succeed in life and to help their communities

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot give, please send this to a friend, college or family member. Please use the Share button.

Please invest in a girl.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brian Davis and I am trying to compete in the European Christmas Quidditch Cup as a gold level snitch. I have been playing quidditch for over a year now and have been invited to snitch events all over the mid-atlantic region, and even last years world cup.

As a college student in his senior year, money is hard to come by. At the moment, I am desperately trying to fundraise for a plane ticket to be an international player headed to england. I already have my living situation arranged, the plane ticket is just the last piece of the puzzle.

Quidditch is an important part of my life because it's an incredibly unique sport, and it's a lot more intense than most people would think at first glance. Most of the players are great people, and it's a fantastic community that I'm happy to be a part of.

By contributing to this campaign, you will get to help expand the horizons of a college student that is reaching beyond the bounds of an average life to take part in an international event that is gaining momentum throughout the world.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm going to need to raise 1,200 USD for a plane ticket to England and back. It's a hefty price, but it's something I'm really striving towards, and any amount would be incredibly helpful.

I am only trying to raise enough money for the plane ticket, but I will be spending my own money on other costs, such as short distance travel, entry fees, food, and lodging. any excess money made by this campaign will go towards those costs.

The Impact

I'm not going to lie and say that this will have some giant impact on the world, but it will have a giant impact on my own life. I have never been overseas before, and I have always wanted to visit Europe. To do that as part of a sports community would be an incredible experience for me, and I am absolutely dying to go experience a part of the world that I've never had a chance to see before. Life is about more than just taking breaths from moment to moment, it's about giving your life a meaning, and I find meaning by putting myself out there and taking advantage of opportunities to do amazing things. So be a part of that and help me put meaning into my life.

Risks & Challenges

I have done fundraising before for my Eagle Scout project, and I have used Indiegogo before in a successful campaign for my fencing club that allowed  us to buy new equipment that otherwise would have been unattainable. So I do have experience in fundraising and following through on my projects.

I understand that this may not be an appealing campaign for most people to contribute to, but I will graciously accept every cent that is handed to me and make the most of it with what I have.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm pretty low on cash (hence the fundraising) so I understand if a lot of people can't donate money regardless of whether or not they want to.

But that doesn't mean that you can't help! Indiegogo has some great sharing tools, and you can always spread this around to get the word out. That can be just as helpful as donating sometimes if it gets to the right people's ears.

story:
Oils, waxes and pastes are very specific when it comes to their use. Problems first occur at the manufacturer and continue all the way to the end user. 
The biggest problems with existing measuring and storing devices for waxes, oils and pastes are:
  • inaccurate dispensing of contents (you never know how much you actually squeezed out - which may result in side effects with exceeded quantity),
  • wax, oil or paste is never managed and stored without contamination,
  • leaky and messy,
  • fragile, easy to break (for example if contents have little viscosity),
  • measuring scale erasure (regular use will blur the scale in no time),
  • not suitable for heating to be able to ensure a higher viscosity. 
If you ever encountered any of the problems above - don't worry, there is a solution to deal with all these problems. Here is the Patron - the answer to all your prayers!



After my grandma's condition and problems involving her medicine I wanted to look for a solution. There were many issues I had to deal with and I believe the Patron will solve most of them. I went all the way from friendly advices to professionals in white suits and all had similar problems. In January 2014 I visited Oregon, USA to visit a friend who organized a conference on medical use of natural extracts. I had a chance to study the procedures and learn the standards when it comes to the use of natural extracts.

While 'learning the ropes' I got an idea for the Patron, which in my language means bullet. The name logically followed its design and I also believe the Patron is a true patron of natural extracts in any way possible.

After a thorough market research and first sketches for the Patron line of products, it became obvious they need to be turned into serial products. I have worked closesly with Primož in the development of industrial designs. First tests showed great results.


After looking through the Patron sketches he suggested alterations for its manufacturing. Short after that the Patron's technical designs, which lead to production of tools for plastic parts, were finished.

The project has now come to a point where we are about to start the production of the Patron line of products. With new exciting products on the drawing board that need upgraded production machinery, we need the 45.000 $ to revise the designs, update the machinery and start a full-blown production of a large range of products that will bring benefit to those who need it most, the ill people who have difficulties every day while trying to measure their medicine. 



Luka Freyer

“I have known Luka for a long time and his ideas never cease to amaze me. When he introduced the project to me, I was immediately drawn to the idea. I felt his determination and vision and decided to devote my full attention to the project. 

Luka's determination to deliver a top-level product has resulted in the highest grade materials to be used in the manufacturing process. His obsession with quality has convinced me that really had the final user in mind while conceiving the product.”   - Primož Pucihar


Primož Pucihar

“Primož is not just my friend. Day by day we continue to learn from each other - that’s why our adventure is so fun right from the start. We both really enjoy working with Patron.” - Luka Freyer

story:
LOOKING FOR A GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO SUPPORT ALTERNATIVE HEALING AND NATURAL MEDICINE?

Then you're in the right place!  

Hello! My name is Megan and I am launching a healing practice called Mother Earth Medicine.


The idea for Mother Earth Medicine was born out of my extensive studies in Ayurveda, Yoga Therapy, Herbal Medicine and Intuitive Energy Work/Clairvoyance.

I am called to be a healer. (Click here to learn more about my journey to becoming one!) After many years of study and practice, I am ready to integrate all of my various skill sets into a comprehensive practice that offers unique and powerful healing to anyone and everyone in need.

When we are in need of healing we may seek the wisdom and support of conventional Western medicine. Sometimes we get what we are looking for, and sometimes conventional medicine leaves us with much to be desired. This is often because conventional medicine fails to acknowledge the more subtle planes of our existence, on which everything is connected.

This is where I can help: I offer Nature-based healing for the spiritual, energetic, mental and physical realms of being, with the acknowledgement that all of these parts of us are interrelated. True healing must address all parts of our experience, including those that are invisible to the naked eye. In doing this, I am able to address the roots of suffering and help my clients realign with their original nature, which is one of wholeness, freedom and well-being.

Mother Earth Medicine will offer several different healing services:

Click on the links to learn more.

-  An Integrated and Progressive Method of Yoga Therapy that calls on the wisdom of Yoga, Ayurveda, Buddhism, Herbal Medicine and related traditions for deep healing and rejuvenation.

-  Plant Spirit Healing that accesses the amazing power of herbal medicine that nourishes and heals the mind, body and soul.

-  Clairvoyant Readings that reconnect people with their own deep reservoir of truth and guidance on the sometimes complicated journey of life.

-  Ayurvedic Consultations that provide people with practical, powerful tools for real healing.

Your contribution (no matter how small!) will help me get this business up and running by early 2015.

Here’s where your money will go:

Start Up Costs: 

Opening a healing practice isn't cheap! I need help with some of the basic costs:

  • Funding and furnishings for an office space in which to see clients.
  • The creation of a logo.
  • Marketing expenses.
  • Hiring a bookkeeper.
  • Purchase of equipment and supplies.

Making Alternative Health Care Available to All: 

I believe that each person has a right to the kind of health care that they feel works best for them. I want my services to be accessible to as many people as possible:

  • Your donation will allow me to see more clients on a generous sliding scale, so that they are able to get the healing they need no matter what their financial situation is.
Even a small contribution goes a long way. With your support, we can create a unique and powerful healing service that integrates timeless wisdom from traditions the world over, and from Mother Nature herself.

Thank you from the very bottom of my heart!

With Deep Love and Gratitude,

Megan


Please spread the word about this campaign! Share it on Facebook, Twitter or your favorite social media site. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

We’d like to introduce you to Family Health Center. We are a local retailer focused on providing natural products for the entire family. Our lineup includes: Vitamins/Minerals, Enzymes, Homeopathy, Aromatherapy, Health & Beauty, Weight Loss, Internal Cleansing, Sports Nutrition, Ear Candles, Spelt Bakery items as well as a variety of non-medical services: Colon Hydrotherapy, Vit D Testing, Iodine spot testing, Live & Dried Blood Analysis, Aqua Chi Foot Bath, Hair Mineral Analysis, Bach Flower Essence formulation, FIR Infrared Sauna, Massage and more. Our philosophy is to provide nutritional information in order for the consumer to become the steward of his or her own health. We believe that if the body is given the right nutritional support, the body can heal itself.

Family Health Center was originally incorporated in 1995 by  mom-Lorena Butts, daughter-Susan (Butts) Wallner and son-David Butts. Susan and David took over ownership and running the day-to-day business in January of 2012. Rounding out their staff is area resident Linda Delap, who has worked in the medical field as a CNA & the natural health field for many years. Linda provides the service of Colon Hydrotherapy.

    Family Health Center will continue to offer and expand non-medical services that allow us to explore root issues for balancing the body and expanding the premium supplements that our customers deserve and have come to expect.

    Your contributions will have a direct impact on the following: Expand non-medical services, Increase the number of guest lecturers, Install informational and interactive kiosks, and start a student scholarship with a focus in the natural health field.

story:
Have you ever questioned the modern medical world, whether for yourself or a loved one?

Have anyone ever suggested you take this or that to treat some symptom and you wondered what was really going on?

Have you ever wondered why it was you really felt like that?

I have.


My name is Jasmine Bell, I am a 25 year old female with a history of questions such as these. Wondering what it was that caused my ovarian cancer and knowing there was more to it that just spontaneous cancer cells growing at an exponential rate, feeling that there was a root, somewhere, leading deeper than that. Listening to loved ones and professionals alike suggesting I try antidepressants to help me come out of the funk that often consumed my life and not feeling like it was the right solution for me. Feeling again, like there were roots somewhere deep, leading to this feeling, and if I could dig them up, could begin to understand the feelings of foggy reality which would perhaps lead toward clarity and happiness.

My story is that of a survivor, it is a journey that has led me inside myself and around the world. I have read books, searching for knowledge that would led me closer to the right path, tried diets, detoxing and cleaning the physical body. I have turned to alcohol and drugs in an attempt to get some relief from my mind and self if only temporarily. I have tried antidepressants feeling as though my resources and will power were slimming in strength. I've traveled searching for myself in remote areas wondering if maybe it was the environment of which I was accustomed to which brought on this dulled state of being. I have dabbled here and there; energy reiki work and courses, to belief based work such as tarot, to physical massage work and courses. What I have learned has been incredible and I have already come such a long way.

Each step that I have taken, each hole that I have tripped in, has brought me to each moment on each path of my journey, which has led me here, to Pisac, Peru. Everything has been in preparation for the program I am about to embark on. I will not delude myself into believing this will be an easy period in my life by no means, but what I do believe is this it is worth it. I am worth my effort and time and resources. I am worth bettering myself. Finding a way to open my heart and my life so I may truly live. So I may have the energy when I feel drawn to hiking to the top of a mountain to photograph the sun rising over the sister mountains, painting the land with a golden glow, feeling the warmth touch my feet and climbing up to my face. Breathing in the fresh air and knowing that the world is beautiful. That I am beautiful - a unique expression in the universe.

I read a line in "The Celestine Prophecy" just the other night that spoke to me. "Working to establish a more comfortable style of survival has grown to feel complete in and of itself as a reason to live, and we've gradually, methodically, forgotten our original question. . . We've forgotten that we still don't know what we're surviving for."

I feel it true - many in this world have become so comfortable in modern life that when an illness or incident comes around, they seek the fastest way to feel the way they felt with the same comforts, not listening to the message that is there, quietly trying to gain attention.

My journey is this: To gain understanding. To learn to accept and appreciate. To do everything I can to ensure my cancer will not resurface because I failed to heed the first message. To know love and light and happiness. To move past the addictive, self medicating stage of my life and subconscious beliefs that brought that around. To cure myself of depression. To life a life I am proud of. And to, once I have found my way back into the warmth of the sunlight, to assist others that are searching as I have, for a way to heal themselves.

With each one thing leading to another, whether it be near in the future or distant, events have aligned for me to find myself at Sananda-Wasi in Pisac, Peru. This is a center where the common belief is that the body is more than capable to heal itself from near most illnesses from life threatening cancers including brain tumors and breast cancer to rheumatoid arthritis to even less tangible ailments such as depression.

The program is the Journey to Rejuvenation. It is truly a holistic approach to health providing tools so I made work on healing my physical body, bring understanding, acceptance, and love to my emotional body, bring clarity and decision to my mental body, and provide a safe space for me to strengthen my spiritual body connection. I will be following a diet similar to the Gerson Therepy which is know for it's effectiveness in treating persons with cancer. For the first week, I will be fasting, drinking only juices to kick start a detox while the rest of the program will consist of whole, raw foods and further cleansing my body via colonics. We will often assess and evaluation to make for a very individualized program. But likely, for the first month and a half, there will be absolutely no salt or sugar in the food, eliminating even natural sugars as in fruits. This is to further allow the body to eliminate toxins that have stored up throughout the body. In addition to diet, there will be other modules of healing tools provided such as massage, art therapy, energy healing, meditation, and yoga.

I have found my way here and have spent many tears and time debating on participating in what I knew/know will be a life altering experience. I was on the fence for quite some time because of the cost associated with this three month program. Money is held at such a high value in the western world, and with having this value placed so high throughout my life, my logical mind wondered if it was worth it, I tried justifying it and wondering if I could find the same results in a less expensive way. I went over in my mind how many wonderful experiences I could have with the money, how many new places I could travel and new skills I could learn and train with. Yes, I thought of all this, my head thought a lot about this decision. And in the end, it was not something my head would figure out, it was a decision that came from the heart. My heart. After having come to center, meeting the family here, feeling how much they love and believe in what they do and how much love they hold in their hearts, so much that there is more that enough overflowing. The team here is beautiful. I asked many questions, I wanted a clear idea to help me make my decision. But really, once I felt how I felt here, I knew how much healing has already and will continue to happen here and I figured, if this isn't worth it, if I am not worth it... Than what is?

The process began there, with that decision, and continues, with me writing this. Explaining who and where I am to the world at large, trusting, in myself and in you, to believe in more than what's expected.. but to go further, and to believe in the self, and to believe in me.

I am offering my photography in exchange for assistance. When I hold a camera in my hand, I become present, aware, awake, and I appreciate the beauty. I wanted to share more than just my story and my gratitude... I feel to share a part of my heart, my soul, and the world as I see it.

Much Love.
story_txt:
Have you ever questioned the modern medical world, whether for yourself or a loved one?Have anyone ever suggested you take this or that to treat some symptom and you wondered what was really going on?
Have you ever wondered why it was you really felt like that?
I have.

My name is Jasmine Bell, I am a 25 year old female with a history of questions such as these. Wondering what it was that caused my ovarian cancer and knowing there was more to it that just spontaneous cancer cells growing at an exponential rate, feeling that there was a root, somewhere, leading deeper than that. Listening to loved ones and professionals alike suggesting I try antidepressants to help me come out of the funk that often consumed my life and not feeling like it was the right solution for me. Feeling again, like there were roots somewhere deep, leading to this feeling, and if I could dig them up, could begin to understand the feelings of foggy reality which would perhaps lead toward clarity and happiness.
My story is that of a survivor, it is a journey that has led me inside myself and around the world. I have read books, searching for knowledge that would led me closer to the right path, tried diets, detoxing and cleaning the physical body. I have turned to alcohol and drugs in an attempt to get some relief from my mind and self if only temporarily. I have tried antidepressants feeling as though my resources and will power were slimming in strength. I've traveled searching for myself in remote areas wondering if maybe it was the environment of which I was accustomed to which brought on this dulled state of being. I have dabbled here and there; energy reiki work and courses, to belief based work such as tarot, to physical massage work and courses. What I have learned has been incredible and I have already come such a long way.
Each step that I have taken, each hole that I have tripped in, has brought me to each moment on each path of my journey, which has led me here, to Pisac, Peru. Everything has been in preparation for the program I am about to embark on. I will not delude myself into believing this will be an easy period in my life by no means, but what I do believe is this it is worth it. I am worth my effort and time and resources. I am worth bettering myself. Finding a way to open my heart and my life so I may truly live. So I may have the energy when I feel drawn to hiking to the top of a mountain to photograph the sun rising over the sister mountains, painting the land with a golden glow, feeling the warmth touch my feet and climbing up to my face. Breathing in the fresh air and knowing that the world is beautiful. That I am beautiful - a unique expression in the universe.
I read a line in "The Celestine Prophecy" just the other night that spoke to me. "Working to establish a more comfortable style of survival has grown to feel complete in and of itself as a reason to live, and we've gradually, methodically, forgotten our original question. . . We've forgotten that we still don't know what we're surviving for."
I feel it true - many in this world have become so comfortable in modern life that when an illness or incident comes around, they seek the fastest way to feel the way they felt with the same comforts, not listening to the message that is there, quietly trying to gain attention.
My journey is this: To gain understanding. To learn to accept and appreciate. To do everything I can to ensure my cancer will not resurface because I failed to heed the first message. To know love and light and happiness. To move past the addictive, self medicating stage of my life and subconscious beliefs that brought that around. To cure myself of depression. To life a life I am proud of. And to, once I have found my way back into the warmth of the sunlight, to assist others that are searching as I have, for a way to heal themselves.
With each one thing leading to another, whether it be near in the future or distant, events have aligned for me to find myself at Sananda-Wasi in Pisac, Peru. This is a center where the common belief is that the body is more than capable to heal itself from near most illnesses from life threatening cancers including brain tumors and breast cancer to rheumatoid arthritis to even less tangible ailments such as depression.
The program is the Journey to Rejuvenation. It is truly a holistic approach to health providing tools so I made work on healing my physical body, bring understanding, acceptance, and love to my emotional body, bring clarity and decision to my mental body, and provide a safe space for me to strengthen my spiritual body connection. I will be following a diet similar to the Gerson Therepy which is know for it's effectiveness in treating persons with cancer. For the first week, I will be fasting, drinking only juices to kick start a detox while the rest of the program will consist of whole, raw foods and further cleansing my body via colonics. We will often assess and evaluation to make for a very individualized program. But likely, for the first month and a half, there will be absolutely no salt or sugar in the food, eliminating even natural sugars as in fruits. This is to further allow the body to eliminate toxins that have stored up throughout the body. In addition to diet, there will be other modules of healing tools provided such as massage, art therapy, energy healing, meditation, and yoga.
I have found my way here and have spent many tears and time debating on participating in what I knew/know will be a life altering experience. I was on the fence for quite some time because of the cost associated with this three month program. Money is held at such a high value in the western world, and with having this value placed so high throughout my life, my logical mind wondered if it was worth it, I tried justifying it and wondering if I could find the same results in a less expensive way. I went over in my mind how many wonderful experiences I could have with the money, how many new places I could travel and new skills I could learn and train with. Yes, I thought of all this, my head thought a lot about this decision. And in the end, it was not something my head would figure out, it was a decision that came from the heart. My heart. After having come to center, meeting the family here, feeling how much they love and believe in what they do and how much love they hold in their hearts, so much that there is more that enough overflowing. The team here is beautiful. I asked many questions, I wanted a clear idea to help me make my decision. But really, once I felt how I felt here, I knew how much healing has already and will continue to happen here and I figured, if this isn't worth it, if I am not worth it... Than what is?
The process began there, with that decision, and continues, with me writing this. Explaining who and where I am to the world at large, trusting, in myself and in you, to believe in more than what's expected.. but to go further, and to believe in the self, and to believe in me.
I am offering my photography in exchange for assistance. When I hold a camera in my hand, I become present, aware, awake, and I appreciate the beauty. I wanted to share more than just my story and my gratitude... I feel to share a part of my heart, my soul, and the world as I see it.


Much Love.

story:
WHO IS NODAS

My name is Zoe Peraki 42 and I live in Thessaloniki Greece. This picture is of my best friend Nondas Nikolaidis 49 a wonderful person, husband, father of a thirteen year old girl, amazing kindergarden teacher and a dear friend to many. Nondas had a terrible accident last January.He fell off his roof while repairing the side wall and fell 11 metres down onto the ground. He suffered many injuries and a severe head trauma. He had surgery as soon as his condition stabilised, and remained in the I.C.U. for 20 days.He was then hospitalised for over a month and has been in a Rehabilitation Center ever since, slowly regaining consciousness and movement ability. We have been very lucky up to now, as hundreds of people came together and offered as much help as possible in order to pay for all the expenses that arose. Last month Nondas went under surgery again for Cranial Reconstruction surgery plus he had a special device inserted in his brain to help his brain fluid flow better. The surgery cost 10.000 euros and it was needed to protect his brain from any future infections or trauma, and speed up his return home to his family and friends. Now due to the crisis in Greece we have been told that Nondas must return home because his health insurance will not renew his stay at the rehab center for more than another month. We actually need a few more months but the cost of each month is over 5000 euros, an amount of money his family has no way of collecting . Also his situation demands of many other health and day to day expences that is bringing his family down to their knees financialy.Nondas needs intense physiotherapy, speech therapy and medical treatment 24/7 and an early return back home might compromise all that the doctors have been trying to do for him at "AROGI" http://www.euromedica-arogi.gr/ If you can help us collect this amount , Nondas will have a better chance to focus on his other disabilities, so that maybe one day he will be able to return to his classroom, and his family won't suffer the endless delays of the Greek national health system which is currently disintegrating due to the crisis. 

WHY HELP?

 Nondas is a wonderful person. Since a young man he has been around children and young people offering knowledge and help. He has been a guardian for children with special needs, for underprivileged children, for children with chronic diseases. He is a successful kindergarden teacher and thousands of children were lucky to start their schooling around him. Nodas also performs puppet theatre with his own handmade puppets, and reads children's books at all sorts of events, mostly at no charge and just to see a smile on a child’s face....!!! Please help us to get Nondas back to the children where he belongs. Your contribution would make a great difference to his life, his care, his family ,his friends and to so many young lives who love him and miss him dearly. PLEASE REMEMBER share our story and stay tuned for updates!!!

story:
My 11 year old daughter died, needlessly, in a Los Angeles hospital 10 years ago.

She would die for the same insane reason, today, ten years later.

She was on an epidural of fentanyl for pain.

She was not connected to any monitors . A pulse ox, the thing we have all had placed on our finger in a hospital, would have saved her life.

The " standard of care " is, a patient on opioids is checked every 2 - 4 hours.

would you leave someone you love alone on morphine for 4 hours?

I never left Leah's side. When I dozed off 30 hours post op, I awakened 90 minutes later to find my child  " DEAD IN BED " that is the actual name for this event


LeahsLaw is simple 

     CONTINUOUS ELECTRONIC MONITORING FOR PATIENTS ON OPIOIDS


The reason this money is so essential now, is that LeahsLaw can get to the California 

Senate floor in January. This requires money for travel, meetings, drafting bills, working 

with health care lobbyists. If not now, the next opportunity is in two years. How many more families will lose a loved one in those two years?

medical error has become the third largest cause of death in America

nobody wants to talk about it, until its too late



LEAHS LAW MAKES GOOD SENSE





Please, dont let this happen to another family.

THIS IS LEAHS TRUE LEGACY. SAVING ANOTHER FAMILY FROM LIVING THROUGH WHAT OUR FAMILY HAS ENDURED, NEEDLESSLY


This CAN happen in 2014. Thats how close we are

PLEASE HELP


Thank You

Lenore

story: The donated soccer equipment will be collected and transported to Nigeria. Upon arrival and after consideration, the soccer balls will be directly distributed to affiliated schools by a sponsoring organization, to ensure equitable distribution to children who need the soccer equipment the most. So far, we have around 750 soccer balls, 1,000 jerseys, 500 pairs of cleats, and 500 pairs of socks. In the face of boko haram and ISIS, we believe that by giving a young child a soccer ball and a pair of cleats, we may deter him or her away from picking up a gun. You can read much more about our campaign at http://www.futball4future.com/

story:
My mom, Terri, has spent the majority of her life caring for those around her,unfortunately sacrificing her own well-being in the process. Her mother was ill with leukemia and ovarian cancer for 12 years when I was a child, which was only overlapped by the fact that I've had severe medical issues I've been dealing with since age 5 (we basically considered the hospital a second home).
 
The real hero in these situations, despite the on-going illnesses around her, has always been my Mom. She took time off of work to raise me, then became a teacher's aid at my school simply to be close to me, be the best she could for other children in need and work hours that fit driving both my Grandmother and myself to doctors appointments and tests nearly every week. 
 
Now that my Grandmother has passed and I'm just beginning to be on the mend, my Mom has recently discovered that she herself has some medical issues that, based on her work schedule and mortgage, she simply won't be able to take care of. 
 
I've always dreamt of providing for her someday - in ANY way - but things have now become dire and I have nowhere else to turn but to the kindness of family, friends and even strangers to help her through this difficult time. 
 
Any amount you could offer in her direction would be *greatly* appreciated; I'm simply setting the goal as high as possible, in hopes that when I see her for her birthday in a month, I can present her not only with a bit of financial support, but the realization that we should never underestimate the kindness and generosity of those who empathize. 
 
Please feel free to donate what you can and, if you can't donate financially, please feel free to do so by passing this link along to anyone you believe could help. 
 
Thank you immensely, 
 
~ ashley rogers
